Acolyte-1.name: Forbidden Knowledge
reminderText: Each point of intelligence grants 4% ward retention and improves skills that rely on carefully studied magic, such as Rip Blood and Summon Skeleton.

Acolyte-3.name: Mania of Mortality
notScalingStats: 10% Chance To Gain Ward On Nearby Death
description: Whenever a nearby enemy, ally, or minion dies, you have a 10% chance to gain ward.
reminderText: Ward is an overshield shield that protects your health. It has no maximum and decays over time.

Acolyte-4.name: Stolen Vitality
reminderText: Each point of vitality grants 6 health and 1% poison and necrotic resistance.

Acolyte-5.name: Ethereal Revenant
description: When damage leaves you below half health, you summon a {Revenant,} a melee minion with decaying health whose damage scales with your intelligence . This effect has a 15 second cooldown.
reminderText: The more modifier to the revenant's damage and health is multiplicative with other modifiers.

Acolyte-6.name: Blood Pact
description: You deal increased damage, but you lose a percent of your maximum health each second if you have killed an enemy recently (last 4 seconds).

Acolyte-8.name: Putrid Demise
stats: 8% Chance To Poison Nearby Enemies On Kill
description: You have additional poison resistance, and whenever you kill an enemy you have a chance to inflict poison on the enemies around them.

Acolyte-10.name: Elixir of Hunger
description: You have additional health, and when you use a potion you and your minions are imbued with {Hunger,} granting 10% increased attack and cast speed and 10 health gained on hit.
reminderText: Hunger does not stack.

Acolyte-12.name: Unbound Necromancy
reminderText: Affects your {Summon Skeleton} skill, but not {Summon Skeletal Mage}.

Acolyte-13.name: Life Drinker
stats: 20% Percent Of Minion's Current HP Consumed
description: Whenever you use a potion you also consume a random minion, killing it to restore health. The health gained in this manner is equal to a percentage of the minion's current health.

Acolyte-15.name: Reclamation of Souls
description: You have increased ward retention, and are granted ward whenever one of your minions die.

Acolyte-17.name: Wisp Weaver
description: Whenever you use a minion skill, you have a chance to gain ward equal to the mana spent.

Acolyte-18.name: Soul Drinker
description: You are granted a percentage of excess healing from {Life Drinker} as ward, up to a maximum.

Acolyte-19.name: Mark of Punishment
stats: 10% Chance To Mark Nearby Enemy On Minion Death
description:
Whenever one of your minions die, it has a chance to mark the nearest enemy for death for 5 seconds.

{Mark for Death} is a curse that lasts for 8 seconds and reduces all resistances by 25%. It cannot stack.

Acolyte-20.name: Dark Retribution
description:
Whenever one of your minions dies, you have a chance to summon a {Skeleton Vanguard} from its corpse, a minion that deals melee physical damage using a spear. You are limited to 3 active skeleton vanguards.
This node also grants additional melee physical damage to Skeleton Vanguards summoned from any source.
reminderText: Skeleton Vanguards are not affected by the Summon Skeleton tree.

Acolyte-22.name: Hollow Lich
description: All sources of health leech are converted to increased damage at 10 times their value.
reminderText:
For example, "1% of spell damage leech as health" would become "10% increased damage".

This does not affect your minions' health leech.

Acolyte-24.name: Cling To Life
description: Grants you Vitality and grants your minions all resistances.
reminderText: Each point of vitality grants 6 health and 1% poison and necrotic resistance.

Acolyte-29.name: Dance with Death
description: You deal increased damage. This bonus is tripled when you are below 35% health.

Acolyte-31.name: Harvested Legions
description:
Whenever you kill an enemy you have a chance to summon a {Skeleton Vanguard} from its corpse, a minion that deals melee physical damage using a spear. You are limited to 3 active skeleton vanguards.
This node also grants increased health to Skeleton Vanguards summoned from any source.
reminderText: Skeleton Vanguards are not affected by the Summon Skeleton tree.

Acolyte-33.name: Soul Barrier
description: When you drop below half health, you are granted ward. This effect has a 12 second cooldown.

Acolyte-35.name: Reaper
description: Your spells and melee attacks instantly kill enemies that they leave below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health).
reminderText: If you have a similar effect from an item or skill tree node then the highest threshold is used.

Acolyte-36.name: Life Barrier
description: {Soul Barrier} grants additional ward equal to your vitality.

Acolyte-37.name: Spirit Lure
description: {Soul Barrier} has a reduced cooldown.

Acolyte-38.name: Crippling Insight
reminderText: Each point of intelligence grants 4% ward retention and improves skills that rely on carefully studied magic, such as Rip Blood and Hungering Souls.

Acolyte-39.name: Bed of Souls
reminderText: Each point of vitality grants 6 health and 1% poison and necrotic resistance.

Acolyte-43.name: Volatile Blood
stats: 10% Chance To Cast Wave Of Blood When Stunned
description: Effects that drain a percentage of your health per second drain reduced health, and when you are stunned you have a chance to release a {Wave of Blood,} dealing physical damage to nearby enemies.
reminderText: {Wave of Blood's} damage scales with your intelligence and with your increases to spell damage and physical damage.

Acolyte-44.name: Symbol of Decay
description: You deal increased damage over time if you are equipped with a one handed weapon and do not have a shield equipped.

Acolyte-45.name: Elixir of Death
stats: 1% Current Health Drained Per Second On Potion Use
description: When you use a potion you take less physical and necrotic damage for 4 seconds (multiplicative with other modifiers), but a percent of your current health is drained each second.

Acolyte-47.name: Wands of the Fallen
description: You deal increased spell damage if you are equipped with a one handed weapon and do not have a shield equipped.

Acolyte-48.name: Mind Over Body
reminderText: Each point of intelligence grants 4% ward retention and improves skills that rely on carefully studied magic, such as Rip Blood and Hungering Souls.

Acolyte-50.name: Soul Stealer
notScalingStats: 13% Chance Per Curse to gain Mana on hit

Acolyte-52.name: Chaos Flames
description:
You deal increased fire damage and have a chance to ignite on hit with fire skills, and you deal increased necrotic damage and have a chance to inflict damned on hit with necrotic skills.

These effects also apply to your minions.

Acolyte-53.name: Spiteful Decay
notScalingStats: 4% More Damage over Time to Cursed

Acolyte-54.name: Harrowing Armor
notScalingStats: 3% More Armor per Curse on Target

Acolyte-55.name: Dark Rituals
notScalingStats: Applies To Player For 10 Seconds On Minion Skill Use
description: Your minions have increased attack and cast speed. This bonus also applies to you if you have used a minion skill in the last 10 seconds.

Acolyte-56.name: Crimson Gluttony
description: You and your minions have increased health regeneration, and effects that drain a percentage of your health drain less health.

Acolyte-58.name: Apocrypha
reminderText: Each point of intelligence grants 4% ward retention and improves skills that rely on carefully studied magic, such as Rip Blood and Hungering Souls.

Acolyte-61.name: Tyrant's Legion
reminderText: Affects your {Summon Skeleton} skill, but not {Summon Skeletal Mage}.

Acolyte-63.name: River of Bones
stats: +4% Critical Strike Damage Leeched As Health
+4% Minion Critical Strike Damage Leeched As Health

Acolyte-64.name: Empty The Graves
description: You have increased health regeneration and additional armor for each minion you control.

Acolyte-69.name: Contagion Engine
stats: 20% Increased Damage Over Time On Recent Kill
description: You deal increased damage over time if you have killed an enemy recently (last 4 seconds).

Acolyte-71.name: Ageless Ascetic
stats: 1% Damage Leeched as Health on Hit
reminderText: Leech from this node only applies to hits, not to damage over time.

Acolyte-74.name: Effigies
description:
When you take a hit while at low health you have a chance to consume one of your minions, stealing its current health to heal yourself.

Your minions deal increased fire and bow damage.
reminderText:
You are on Low Health if your current health is below 35% of your maximum health.

The healing is not affected by your increased healing effectiveness.

Acolyte-75.name: Aegisfall
description: Your minions have a chance to shred armour on hit

Acolyte-76.name: Moonlight Pyre
description: Your minions deal additional fire and necrotic damage with spells and attacks.

Acolyte-77.name: Veins of Malice
description: Whenever you cast a spell, you sacrifice 5% of your current health to grant your minions {Haste} and {Frenzy} for a duration. This effect has a 10 second cooldown.

Acolyte-80.name: Soul Aegis
description: Your minions have additional armor per character level.
reminderText: Character level is the level of your character, not your minions.

Acolyte-82.name: Eye of Damnation
description: You and your minions deal increased necrotic damage and you have a chance to apply Damned on hit.
reminderText: This node does not give your minions a chance to apply Damned on hit.

Acolyte-83.name: Dominion of Rot
description: You deal increased poison damage and your minions have a chance to poison on hit.

Acolyte-84.name: Veins of Power
description: You and your minions deal increased physical damage and have increased bleed duration

Acolyte-86.name: Cauldron of Blood
notScalingStats: Rip Blood on up to 5 enemies

Acolyte-87.name: Dark Protections
notScalingStats: 2% Less Damage Taken Per Curse On Target

Acolyte-89.name: Ward of Malevolence
stats: +1 Ward Per Second Per 3 Intelligence While Channeling
description:
You gain additional ward decay threshold and you gain ward on kill. 

You also gain ward per 2 points of Intelligence while channeling a skill.

Acolyte-90.name: Crimson Favors
notScalingStats: 1 Rip Blood Casts Each Second With Bleed Overload
description: Your {Rip Blood's} hits have a chance to bleed enemies.

Acolyte-91.name: Imperishable
notScalingStats: +1 Ward Decay Threshold Per 1% Necro Res

Acolyte-92.name: Doom Herald
stats: 2% More Damage to Damned while Channeling
description: You take less damage while channeling and deal more damage to damned enemies while channeling (both multiplicative with other modifiers).

Acolyte-93.name: Spirit Leech
description: A portion of the damage you do is returned to you as health over 3 seconds.

Acolyte-94.name: Rancid Concoction
notScalingStats: Potion Spreads Poisons during Poison Overload
description: You gain ward and mana when you use a potion.

Acolyte-98.name: Chains of Ruin
reminderText: Chaining an enemy to the ground deals necrotic damage over time and immobilizes them.

Acolyte-100.name: Encroaching Darkness
description: When you directly cast a {Curse} skill you also afflict a number of enemies around the target location with {Anguish}.

Acolyte-101.name: The Ashen One
notScalingStats: Witchfire on Ignite or Damned Overload

Acolyte-102.name: Chaotic Strikes
description:
Your hits have a chance to deal double damage.

Additionally your hits have a chance to deal double damage per {Curse} on the target.

Acolyte-103.name: Scorched Reach
notScalingStats: Flame Whip on Hit or Kill against Ignited

Acolyte-104.name: Grasping Damnation
notScalingStats: 30% Chance to Chain Damned enemies each second
description: The Chains from the {Chains of Ruin} node last longer. Additionally damned that you inflict last longer.

Acolyte-105.name: Duskbringer
notScalingStats: Hitting Boss or Rare triggers Anguish

Acolyte-106.name: Fleeting Crone
stats: +5% Haste Chance when Hitting Boss or Rare
description:
You have a chance to gain {Haste} for 2 seconds when you kill a {Cursed} enemy or hit a {Cursed} boss or rare enemy.

Additionally {Haste} on you has increased effect.

Acolyte-107.name: Vessel of Chaos
notScalingStats: 3% More Damage Over Time per Overload
reminderText: {Ailment Overloads} include {Bleed}, {Poison}, {Damned} and {Ignite Overload}.

Acolyte-109.name: Accursed Seer
notScalingStats: Cleanse all Curses when reaching Low Health
100 Ward Gain per Cleansed Curse on You

Acolyte-110.name: Grimhilde's Domain
stats: 1% More Witchfire Damage per Ignite chance
3% More Witchfire Damage per Damned chance
description:
{Witchfire} that you inflict deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per 1% global chance to ignite with fire skills and per 1% global chance to inflict damned with necrotic skills.

Additionally while you have {Ignite} or {Damned Overload} your hits spread {Witchfire} to a number of enemies within 10 meters.

Acolyte-111.name: Aspect of Death
stats: 0.04% More Damage per Negative Ailment on You
notScalingStats: Damn Yourself on Kill or Minion Kill
description: You have increased health and you deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per stack of each negative ailment on you up to a maximum of 90.

Lich.name: Lich
stats: 1% of damage dealt is leeched as health
Spells and Melee attacks deal increased damage equal to your missing health

Warlock.name: Warlock
stats: 5% more damage per curse on the target

aa710-0.name: Assemble Abomination
description: Hold ability key to channel to increase the area. When you release, combine all of your minions in the area into a single hulking abomination with states based on which minions are consumed.

aa710-2.name: Hulking Mass
description: Your abomination has more health (multiplicative with other modifiers).

aa710-3.name: Unholy Command
description:
Your abomination grants additional armor to nearby minions for each minion it consumed.

When your abomination dies this effect is also granted to your minions by its corpse.

aa710-4.name: Devour
description:
You no longer channel to summon your abomination. Instead it consumes your nearest 5 minions to be summoned.

Assemble Abomination costs more mana.

aa710-5.name: Shattered Limbs
description: Your abomination has increased critical strike chance, but can no longer regenerate health or consume Bone Golems.
reminderText: The Abomination can still recover health by methods other than health regen.

aa710-6.name: Spoils of War
stats: Double Strike Gained on Melee Skeleton Consumption
description: If a Skeleton Warrior, Rogue or Vanguard is consumed, your abomination is granted the ability to {Double Strike,} and the first attack causes enemies to bleed.

aa710-7.name: Flesh and Blood
description: Your abomination's melee hits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but can no longer consume Skeletal Mages.

aa710-9.name: Age of Undeath
stats: Can only Consume Skeletons and Skeletal Mages
No decay until you have 6+ Skeletons or Skeletal Mages
description: You can now only consume minions from the {Summon Skeletons} and {Summon Skeletal Mages} skills to create the Abomination. However the Abomination does not start to decay until you control 6 or more such minions at the same time.
reminderText:
If you drop below 6 Skeletons and Skeletal Mages, the health decay does not stop.

If your maximum number of skeletons or skeletal mages is reduced by respeccing or other methods while you have an active Abomination it will start decaying.

aa710-11.name: Fractured End
description: When your abomination dies, it disassembles into a number of Skeleton Vanguards.
reminderText: Skeleton Vanguards are minions that deals melee physical damage using a spear.

aa710-12.name: Repugnant Presence
description: Your abomination reflects a percentage of damage to attackers and generates more threat, which increases the likelihood of enemies targeting it.

aa710-13.name: Domination
description: Your abomination deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

aa710-14.name: The Quick and the Dead
description: Your abomination deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but decays faster.

aa710-15.name: Imprisoned Horror
description: You abomination is impaled by bone spikes, granting it significantly increased damage, but is rendered immobile and drains health faster.

aa710-16.name: Consume
description: Your abomination's hits leech a portion of the damage they deal as health.

aa710-17.name: Unholy Reach
description: Your abomination's melee attacks deal damage in a larger area.

aa710-18.name: Reap The Damned
stats: Soul Reave Gained On Wraith Consumption
description: If a {Wraith} is consumed, its melee attack is replaced with {Soul Reave}, which deals melee necrotic damage.

aa710-19.name: Shattered Similacrum
description: If a {Golem} is consumed, your abomination uses {Stomp,} a melee attack that deals physical damage and has a high chance to stun enemies in a large area.

aa710-20.name: Meat Grinder
description:
Your abomination gains 10% increased damage when it kills an enemy. This effect stacks up to 10 times.

The abomination gains 2 stacks instead if the target is undead.

aa710-21.name: Stitched Flesh
description: Your abomination's health decays slower.

aa710-22.name: Cadaverous Carapace
description: Your abomination's health decays at half the rate, but your abomination deals less damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

aa710-23.name: Dead Eye
stats: Arrow Nova Gained On Skeletal Archer Consumption
description: If a {Skeletal Archer} is absorbed, your abomination casts {Arrow Nova} every 4 seconds, a ranged ability that deals physical damage to enemies.

aa710-24.name: Horrific Volley
description: Your abomination's {Arrow Nova} fires more frequently and deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

aa710-26.name: Engorgement
description: Your abomination deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) for each minion consumed to create it (up to a maximum).

aa710-27.name: Epicurean
stats: +6% Damage Per Type Of Minion Consumed
description: Your abomination deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) for each type of minion consumed to create it.
reminderText: If a minion has a different name, it's considered a different type of minion.

aa710-28.name: Death in the Family
stats: +30% Attack Speed When 5 Types Of Minions Consumed
description: If you absorb at least five different types of minion, Assemble Abomination has increased attack and cast speed.
reminderText: If a minion has a different name, it's considered a different type of minion

aa710-29.name: Corrupt Palate
stats: Devouring Souls Gained On Mage Consumption
description: If a Skeletal Mage is consumed, your abomination can cast {Devouring Souls}.
reminderText: Devouring Souls is a necrotic spell that fires 5 projectiles by default and has a 6 second cooldown. On hit, enemies are afflicted with Possess, which deals necrotic damage over time for 1.5 seconds and cannot stack.

aa710-30.name: Frightful Feast
description: Your abomination's {Devouring Souls} releases an additional soul for each Skeletal Mage that was consumed to summon your abomination.

aa710-31.name: A Violent End
description: Your abomination deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) for 8 seconds after it has been summoned.

aa710-32.name: Bloated Corpse
stats: Explosive Slam Attack Gained On Zombie Consumption
description: If a {Volatile Zombie} is consumed, your Abomination gains an explosive {Tail Slam} ability.

aa710-33.name: Rapacious Protection
description: Your abomination also gains the combined health of all consumed Bone Golems as armor, and will focus on protecting you from nearby enemies.

ad0ry-2.name: Rot Weaver
description: Aura of Decay applies poison and other ailments to enemies more frequently.

ad0ry-3.name: Icarian Poison
description: Aura of Decay applies poison and other ailments to enemies more frequently, but poison is applied to your self more and more frequently as time goes on.

ad0ry-4.name: Unending Sickness
description: Poison and other ailments inflicted by Aura of Decay last longer. This does not include ailments that slow.

ad0ry-5.name: Mana Blight
description: Aura of Decay applies Poison and other ailments to enemies more frequently, but drains mana each second.

ad0ry-6.name: Poisoned Soul
description: Aura of Decay applies poison and other ailments to enemies more frequently, but also applies poison to yourself more frequently.

ad0ry-7.name: Seeping Wounds
description: Aura of Decay has a chance to cause enemies to bleed each second.

ad0ry-8.name: Armorbane
description:
Aura of Decay inflicts Armor Shred instead of Poison to you and enemies. 

Armor Shred inflicted by Aura of Decay has 100% increased effectiveness.

ad0ry-9.name: Corrosive Aura
description: Enemies affected by Aura of Decay have reduced armor.

ad0ry-10.name: Undertow
description: Aura of Decay has a chance to slow nearby enemies every second.

ad0ry-11.name: Putrid Bombs
description: While Aura of Decay is active, you leave behind a {Putrid Bomb} every 2 seconds. Putrid Bombs explode after a 2 second delay and Poison all enemies they hit.

ad0ry-12.name: Chill to the Bone
description: Aura of Decay has a chance to Chill nearby enemies every second.

ad0ry-13.name: Absence of Life
description: Allies within range are healed by Aura of Decay each second. Aura of Decay heals more health the less health you currently have.
reminderText: "Allies" includes you.

ad0ry-14.name: Plague Bearers
description: Minions within Aura of Decayâ€™s area of effect have a chance to poison on hit, but are poisoned every second.

ad0ry-15.name: Infectious Bones
description: Minions within Aura of Decayâ€™s area of effect deal more poison damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ad0ry-16.name: Loathing
description: While Aura of Decay is active, enemies have a chance to be {Marked for Death} when they hit you.

ad0ry-17.name: Feast of Souls
description: While Aura of Decay is active, you have a chance to cast {Soul Feast} when you are hit.
reminderText: Soul Feast is a spell that hits all cursed enemies, dealing necrotic damage to them, and drawing a fragment of each of their the souls back to you. The soul fragments each grant 5 ward when they reach you.

ad0ry-18.name: Growing Hunger
stats: 10% Soul Feast Chance Increase On Fail
description: Your chance to cast {Soul Feast} when hit increases each time you fail to cast Soul Feast.

ad0ry-19.name: Poison Skin
description: Enemies are inflicted with multiple stacks of Poison when they hit you, but you also gain poison stacks when hit.

ad0ry-20.name: Inoculation
description: You take less poison damage while Aura of Decay is active (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ad0ry-21.name: Vulnerability
description: Enemies within Aura of Decayâ€™s area of effect have less Poison Resistance.
reminderText: This does not apply the {Poison Resistance Shred} ailment, but instead stacks additively with it.

ad0ry-22.name: Fume Weaver
description: You and Enemies within Aura of Decayâ€™s area of effect have less poison resistance for each point of intelligence you have.

ad0ry-23.name: Poison Bolt
description: Aura of Decay fires a {Poison Bolt} that inflicts two stacks of poison on hit at the nearest enemy every 3 seconds.

ad0ry-24.name: Poison Barrage
description: Aura of Decay fires {Poison Bolts} more frequently.

ad0ry-25.name: Corruption
description: Enemies that die within Aura of Decayâ€™s area of effect have a chance to emit a {Poison Nova}, which poisons all enemies it hits. This effect has a 5 second cooldown by default.

ad0ry-26.name: Death Bloom
description: {Poison Nova} has a shorter cooldown.
reminderText: {Poison Nova} poisons all enemies it hits. This effect has a 5 second cooldown by default.

ad0ry-27.name: Bubonic Aura
description: Aura of Decay has a chance to inflict nearby enemies with {Plague} each second.

ad0ry-28.name: Plague Rat
description: Aura of Decay affects a larger area.

ad0ry-29.name: Aura of Terror
description: Nearby enemies have a chance to be feared when you activate Aura of Decay.

ad0ry-30.name: Respite
stats: +15% Poison Resistance in Aura of Decay
description: You have additional posion resistance while in Aura of Decay and you have increased health regeneration if you have deactivated Aura of Decay recently (past 4 seconds).

ad0ry-31.name: Incipient Decay
description: When you activate Aura of Decay, you create a {Poison Nova} around yourself that poisons all enemies it hits. This effect has a 5 second cooldown.

bc53-0.name: Bone Curse
description: Apply a curse to enemies in an area that causes spell physical damage when hit.

bc53-1.name: Iron Maiden
description: Bone Curse deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

bc53-2.name: Brittle Bones
description:
Bone Curse deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and instantly kills enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health).

If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

bc53-3.name: Ruptured Corpse
description: Enemies afflicted with Bone Curse have a chance to explode on death, dealing damage to nearby enemies, but Bone Curse costs more mana.

bc53-4.name: Entreat the Damned
description: Killing an enemy with Bone Curse has a chance to summon a Skeleton Vanguard, a minion that deals melee physical damage using a spear. You are limited to 3 Skeleton Vanguards by default.

bc53-5.name: Bone Eruption
description: Shortly after casting Bone Curse, it causes a {Bone Eruption} beneath the target area, causing enemies to take spell physical damage, but Bone Curse Costs more mana.

bc53-6.name: Acute Infliction
description: Bone Curse deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but falls off after a few hits.

bc53-7.name: Signet of Agony
description:
Bone Curse becomes a toggled aura which surrounds you, but it has reduced area and drains your mana over time. You are also inflicted with Bone Curse.

This is not compatible with the {Oppressive Gaze} and {Illusion of Pain} nodes.

bc53-8.name: Illusion of Pain
stats: -50% Cursed Limbs and Cursed Ground duration
description:
Bone Curse falls off after only 1 hit, but it always crits and deals significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers). Bone Curse now has a cooldown.

This is not compatible with the {Signet of Agony} node.
The duration of {Cursed Limbs} and {Cursed Ground} are significantly reduced.

bc53-9.name: Defile Defenses
description: Bone Curse has a chance to reduce enemy armor.

bc53-10.name: Marrow Thief
description: If you kill an enemy affected by Bone Curse you have a chance to gain {Bone Armor} for 4 seconds, which grants less damage taken (multiplicative with other modifiers).

bc53-11.name: Bone Feast
description:
When {Marrow Thief} triggers you are also healed. 

The healing scales with healing effectiveness.

bc53-12.name: Cloven Flesh
description: Bone Curse has a chance to cause enemies to bleed.

bc53-13.name: Crimson Enlightenment
stats: Rip Blood On Bone Curse Time Out
description: When Bone Curse times out, you cast {Rip Blood} on that enemy, a spell dealing physical damage.
reminderText: Rip Blood cast this way cannot apply Bone Curse, even if you have the {Cursed Limbs} node.

bc53-14.name: Cursed Ground
description: When you cast Bone Curse, it now also leaves behind {Cursed Ground} for a short duration. Enemies that walk into the Cursed Ground are afflicted with Bone Curse.

bc53-15.name: Conflation
description: Bone Curse affects a larger area.

bc53-16.name: Bone Prison
description:
When you directly cast Bone Curse you summon a {Bone Prison} around the target area, trapping enemies inside. Bone Prison lasts a long time, but can be attacked and destroyed.

Bone Curse has a significantly longer cooldown.

bc53-17.name: Shattered Prison
description: Bone Curse has a significantly shorter cooldown, but {Bone Prison} now has gaps.

bc53-18.name: Ossify
description: Your {Bone Prison} takes less damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

bc53-19.name: Sigil of Mortality
description:
Bone Curse applies {Mark for Death} for 2 seconds, but costs more mana.

This effect overwrites {Mark for Death's} normal duration.

bc53-20.name: Reaper's Mark
description: {Mark for Death} lasts longer.

bc53-21.name: Misery
description: Bone Curse's base physical damage is converted to necrotic. Consequently this damage scales with increases to necrotic damage, but not increases to physical damage.

bc53-22.name: Oppressive Gaze
description:
Bone Curse deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but now only affects a single target. Bone Curse and Mark for Death have unlimited duration.

This is not compatible with the {Signet of Agony} node.

bc53-23.name: Crippling Anguish
description: Bone Curse slows enemies within its area of effect

bc53-24.name: Swift Release
description: Bone Curse deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but lingers for a shorter duration on enemies if not reapplied. The duration reduction only applies to Bone Curse applied by the aura.
reminderText: Does not affect the duration of Bone Curse on minions.

bc53-25.name: Cultist's Fervor
description: Bone Curse costs less mana and has increased cast speed.

bc53-26.name: Chilblains
description: Bone Curse has a chance to apply chill when the enemy is hit.

bc53-27.name: Bitter Winter
description: Adds a freeze rate to Bone Curse, granting it a chance to freeze enemies.

bc53-28.name: Merciless
description:
You may cast Bone Curse on your minions, which grants them more physical damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but also applies Bone Curse's negative effects. 

This effect lasts 4 seconds and does not stack.

bc53-29.name: Spiked Bones
description:
Casting Bone Curse on minions causes them to reflect a flat amount damage to attackers. 

This effect lasts 4 seconds and does not stack.

bc53-30.name: Barbed Construct
description: All minion buffs from Bone Curse have 200% increased effect on Bone Golems.

bc53-31.name: Cursed Limbs
stats: Bone Curse On Hit After Direct Cast
description:
After directly casting Bone Curse, you also cast Bone Curse on hit for the next few seconds, but Bone Curse costs more mana.
This cast on hit effect can't occur more than once per second.
reminderText: Bone Curse cast this way does not consume mana, but can not grant Cursed Limbs.

bg36nl-2.name: Amalgam of Rogues
description: Your Golem moves and attacks faster.

bg36nl-3.name: Twinned Golems
description: You summon an additional Golem, but each Golem has reduced maximum health, is smaller, and deals less damage (all multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: This node's modifiers to health and damage are multiplicative with other modifiers

bg36nl-4.name: Ivory Twin
stats: Golem Summons Also Summon A Bone Golem
description: Your Golems deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers). If Bone Golems have been replaced by another type of Golem, you now have an equal chance to summon a Bone Golem.

bg36nl-5.name: Burning Bones
description: Your Golem has a chance to ignite enemies, it also has additional fire resistance and deals more damage over time (multiplicative with other modifiers).

bg36nl-6.name: Charred Bones
description: Your Golem deals additional fire damage with spells and melee attacks.

bg36nl-7.name: Pyre Golem
description:
You now summon a {Pyre Golem} instead of a Bone Golem.

The base physical damage of Pyre Golems' melee attacks is converted to fire. Consequently this damage scales with increases to minion fire damage, but not increases to minion physical damage.

Pyre Golems also cast {Infernal Aura}, a spell that deals a burst of fire damage on cast and fire damage over time afterwards.
reminderText: If you have multiple golem type nodes, you will summon a random golem.

bg36nl-8.name: World Pyre
description: Your Golem deals more damage over time (multiplicative with other modifiers), and {Pyre Golems}â€™ {Infernal Aura} deals damage in a larger area.

bg36nl-9.name: Unnatural Speed
description: Your Golem causes all nearby minions to move faster, including themselves. This bonus is doubled for the Golems themselves.

bg36nl-10.name: Infected Remains
stats: 10% Chance To Grant Putrid Coating When Hit
description: Your Golem has a chance to grant you a stack of {Putrid Coating} when it is hit. Each stack lasts for 8 seconds and grants you a chance to poison enemies.

bg36nl-11.name: Cold Vengeance
description: Your Golem deals additional melee cold damage and it has a chance to chill attackers when hit.

bg36nl-12.name: Deathchill Golem
description:
You now summon a {Deathchill Golem} instead of a Bone Golem. 

The base physical damage of Deathchill Golems' melee attacks is converted to cold. Consequently this damage scales with increases to minion cold damage, but not increases to minion physical damage. Death Chill Golems' melee attacks gain a Freeze Rate equal to twice their base damage.

Deathchill Golem also casts Freezing Grasp, a spell that deals cold damage and has high freeze rate. Bosses cannot be frozen by this.
reminderText: If you have multiple golem type nodes, you will summon a random golem.

bg36nl-13.name: Amalgam of Sentinels
description: Your Golem has additional health and armor, as well as more health and armor (both multiplicative with other modifiers).

bg36nl-14.name: Bladed Fists
description: Your Golem deals more damage with melee attacks (multiplicative with other modifers), and has an increased chance to stun with melee attacks.

bg36nl-15.name: Tower of Bones
description: Your Golem is larger (multiplicative with other modifiers) and generates more threat, which increases the likelihood of enemies targeting it.

bg36nl-16.name: Fragments of the Fallen
stats: +15% Size if no other living Golems
+25% Damage if no other living Golems
description:
Your Golems have increased size and deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) if you have no other living golems when you summon them.

Your Golems have significantly higher armor for the first 15 seconds of their life when summoned near the corpse of another Golem.

bg36nl-17.name: Amalgam of Primalists
description: Your Golem grants additional armor to nearby minions, including itself.

bg36nl-18.name: Hunger
description: Your Golem's hits restore health to you and itself. This effect restores additional health per 2 Vitality.

bg36nl-19.name: Blood Golem
description:
You now summon a {Blood Golem} instead of a Bone Golem. 

Blood Golems can also cast {Sanguine Orb}, a spell that deals physical damage to nearby enemies over 2 seconds.
reminderText: If you have multiple golem type nodes, you will summon a random golem.

bg36nl-20.name: Amalgam of Mages
description: Your Golem deals more spell damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), and has an increased chance to stun.

bg36nl-21.name: Bone Hail
description: Your Golem has a higher chance to retaliate with {Bone Shatter} when hit and its Bone Shatter deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

bg36nl-22.name: Flight of the Femurs
description: Your Golem's {Bone Shatter} projectiles pierce (continue through targets they hit) and travel faster, causing them to also travel further.

bg36nl-23.name: Bone Growth
description: Your Golem has additional health regeneration based on your total amount of health regeneration.

bg36nl-24.name: Marrow Eater
description: Your Golem gains significantly more armor for 8 seconds whenever a skeleton minion dies nearby.

bg36nl-25.name: Betrayal
stats: Triple Bone Shatter Chance From Ally Hits
description: If you only control one Golem, it has a much higher chance to retaliate with {Bone Shatter} when damaged by hits from allies.
reminderText:
This effect only applies to hits that damage the Bone Golem.

The default chance (without taking this node) for an ally's hit to cause a {Bone Shatter} is the same as the chance for hits from enemies.

bg36nl-26.name: Breath of Formosus
stats: +1 Freezing Grasp Freeze Rate per Vitality
description: Your Golem's {Freezing Grasp} spell now has additional spell damage and base freeze rate per point of Vitality.

bg36nl-28.name: Bone Kindling
stats: +80% Infernal Aura Damage Per Skeletal Mage
description: {Pyre Golems}â€™ {Infernal Aura} consumes {Skeletons} and {Skeletal Mages} that it hits to deal more damage over time (multiplicative with other modifiers) per minion it consumed.

bp2nk-2.name: Bone Knives
description: Marrow Shards and {Bone Splinters} hits deal significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but Marrow Shards no longer pierces.

bp2nk-3.name: Marrow Hunger
description: You leech a portion of physical damage as health if you have cast Marrow Shards recently (past 4 seconds).

bp2nk-4.name: Splintering Impact
description: Marrow Shards creates {Bone Splinters} in a cone behind the enemy when destroyed, damaging other enemies, but Marrow Shards no longer pierces and costs more health.
reminderText: {Bone Splinters} scale with increases to physical damage and spell damage, but not with other nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

bp2nk-5.name: Carving
description: {Bone Splinters} deal more damage.

bp2nk-6.name: Ghost Splinters
description: {Bone Splinters} travel faster and further.
reminderText: {Bone Splinters} scale with increases to physical damage and spell damage, but not with other nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

bp2nk-7.name: Gouging Splinters
description: {Bone Splinters} have a chance to cause enemies to bleed.

bp2nk-8.name: Crimson Ivory
description: {Bone Splinters} hits deal more damage against bleeding enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

bp2nk-9.name: Dark Precision
description: Improves {Bone Splinters'} base critical strike chance.

bp2nk-10.name: Ivory Obliteration
description: {Bone Splinters} critical strikes deal more damage.

bp2nk-11.name: Dead Weight
description: Marrow Shards and {Bone Splinters} hits deal more damage, but Marrow Shards travels less far.

bp2nk-12.name: Blood Assassin
description: Marrow Shards and {Bone Splinters} have improved base critical strike chance and critical strikes deal more damage.

bp2nk-13.name: Marrow Death
description: Marrow Shards and {Bone Splinters} deal more damage with critical strikes.

bp2nk-14.name: Femoral Offering
description: Marrow Shards and {Bone Splinters} critical strikes deal more damage, but you lose health when you critically strike with Marrow Shards.

bp2nk-15.name: Twin Malevolence
description:
If you have exactly two minions when you cast Marrow Shards, you have increased critical strike chance for 2 seconds. 

You cannot have multiple instances of this buff at once.

bp2nk-16.name: Bone Splinters
description: Marrow Shards creates {Bone Splinters} in a cone when destroyed, which damage enemies, but Marrow Shards travels less far and costs more health.
reminderText: {Bone Splinters} scale with increases to physical damage and spell damage, but not with other nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

bp2nk-17.name: Marrow Caster
description: Marrow Shards are destroyed at the location you target if it is within their maximum range. Marrow Shards costs more health.

bp2nk-18.name: Ossumancy
description: When you directly cast Marrow Shards, you have a chance to immediately cast a second instance of Marrow Shards. The additional cast does cost health.

bp2nk-19.name: Shredding Bones
description: Marrow Shards and {Bone Splinters} hits have a chance to shred enemy armor.

bp2nk-20.name: Apathy
description:
Marrow Shards and {Bone Splinters} deal more damage, but Marrow Shards can hit and damage your own minions. 

On hit effects, such as health gained on hit, do not proc when you hit your minions.

bp2nk-21.name: Treachery
description: You gain health when you kill one of your own minions.

bp2nk-22.name: Dark Reverie
description: Grants you increased critical strike chance if you have killed with Marrow Shards or {Bone Splinters} recently (past 4 seconds).
reminderText: {Bone Splinters} scale with increases to physical damage and spell damage, but not with other nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

bp2nk-23.name: Blood Reverie
description: You leech a portion of physical damage as life if you have killed with Marrow Shards recently (past 4 seconds).

bp2nk-24.name: Soul Blood
description: Marrow Shards and {Bone Splinters} have a chance to cause enemies to bleed, but Marrow Shards costs more health.

bp2nk-25.name: Bones Of The Follower
description: Marrow Shards hits deal significantly more damage, but consumes one of your minions when you cast it.
reminderText: The damage bonus is only gained if a minion is consumed.

bp2nk-26.name: Rip Marrow
description: Marrow Shards has a chance to create a {Marrow Orb} on hit that returns 15 health to you.
reminderText: {Marrow Orbs} are a bloody projectile which restores health upon returning to you.

bp2nk-27.name: Marrow Eater
description: {Marrow Orbs} return more health.
reminderText: {Marrow Orbs} are a bloody projectile which restores health upon returning to you.

bp2nk-28.name: Life Blood
description: Marrow Shards hits have a higher chance to create a {Marrow Orb}.
reminderText: {Marrow Orbs} are a bloody projectile which restores health upon returning to you.

bp2nk-29.name: Spirit Feast
stats: +33% Marrow Orb Chance To Gain Mana
description: {Marrow Orbs} have a chance to also replenish mana.
reminderText: {Marrow Orbs} are a bloody projectile which restores health upon returning to you.

bp2nk-30.name: Demise
description: Marrow Shards hits deal more damage against bleeding enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ch0fs-2.name: Fragile Crust
description:
Chthonic Fissure costs less mana and it refunds some of its mana cost if there is a cursed player, rare enemy or boss within 20 meters when you cast it.

This effect also works if you are Cursed.

ch0fs-3.name: Fell Fire
description: {Tormenting} an ignited enemy spreads all of your ignite stacks from it to a number of other enemies around it.
reminderText: Converted ailments are also spread.

ch0fs-4.name: Stygian Current
description: The Fissure releases {Spirits} more frequently.

ch0fs-5.name: Of Gloom and Flames
description: Chthonic Fissure now creates a secondary Fissure in the opposite direction that casts its own {Spirits}. Enemies can take damage from both Fissures if they stand on both, but Chthonic Fissure costs significantly more mana.
reminderText: This effect will not create more than 2 Fissures if you also have {The Sunderer's Domain} node.

ch0fs-6.name: Chaotic Rupture
stats: 13% Chance to replace Spirits with Chaos Bolts
description:
{Spirits} now have a chance to be replaced by a cast of {Chaos Bolts} that consumes a portion of its mana cost and scales with your {Chaos Bolts} tree.

{Chaos Bolts} cast this way have a chance to have no additional projectiles.

ch0fs-7.name: Spirit Gale
description: When {Tormented} enemies die they have a chance to release the {Spirit} to inflict and {Torment} another enemy within 8 meters.

ch0fs-8.name: Severed Wards
description: The {Spirits'} hits shred enemy necrotic resistance.

ch0fs-9.name: Singed by Terror
description: The {Spirits'} hits shred enemy fire resistance.

ch0fs-10.name: Return Below
stats: Infernal Shade deals its Remaining Damage
description: When {Spirits} {Torment} an enemy afflicted by an {Infernal Shade} they consume the Shade, causing it to instantly deal its remaining damage and increases all existing Chthonic Fissures' frequency of releasing {Spirits} up to a maximum.

ch0fs-11.name: Damned Waters
description: The {Spirits'} hits inflict enemies with {Damned}.

ch0fs-12.name: Grim Tide
stats: +1% Necrotic Damage per 1% Added Crit Multi
description: Chthonic Fissure and ailments it inflicts deal more necrotic damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per 1% Added Critical Strike Multiplier.
reminderText: This doesn't include the base 200% crit multi.

ch0fs-13.name: Twisted Waves
description: {Torment} deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) based on your uncapped necrotic resistance.

ch0fs-14.name: Eradication
description:
Chthonic Fissure deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to rare enemies and bosses.

This effect is doubled if the enemy or you are cursed.

ch0fs-15.name: Beacon of Torment
description:
{Spirits} now target you instead of enemies, and whenever you are {Tormented} or {Torment's} duration on you is refreshed, you gain additional spell damage and Endurance Threshold.

This buff can stack and has the same duration as {Torment}, but persists if {Torment} is cleansed.

ch0fs-16.name: Grasp of the Undying
stats: +2% Fissure Direct Damage bonus per Second
description: The Fissure deals more direct damage for each second it is active (multiplicative with other modifiers) and you leech a portion of the damage it does.
reminderText: Direct damage modifiers do not affect damage of ailments and subskills from Chthonic Fissure.

ch0fs-17.name: The Sunderer's Domain
description:
You can now have additional Fissures active at a time, but {Spirits} are released less frequently.

If a Fissure is placed over an existing one, the new Fissure closes after 1 second.
reminderText: You cannot create more than 2 Fissures if you also have the {Of Gloom and Flames} node.

ch0fs-18.name: Deepest Ravine
description: Chthonic Fissure deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but it no longer releases {Spirits}.

ch0fs-19.name: Rekindled Graves
description:
Fissures now cast {Volatile Zombies} every 2 seconds, but consumes mana equal to a portion of {Volatile Zombies} mana cost.

{Volatile Zombie} cast this way has a chance to not create multiple {Zombies} if it would otherwise.

ch0fs-20.name: Death from Below
description:
Chthonic Fissure deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

This effect is doubled if you are cursed.

ch0fs-21.name: Pyrochasm
description: The Fissure's initial impact now hits enemies dealing spell fire damage, with added damage applying at 300% effectiveness for this hit.
reminderText: This hit can be converted to to physical by {Blood Gulch}, or to necrotic by {Valley of Defilement}.

ch0fs-22.name: Fissure of Wrath
stats: +1 Fissure Spell Damage per 2% Ignite Chance
5% Fissure Increased Stun Chance per 2% Ignite Chance
description:
The Fissure's initial hit now deals additional spell damage with a higher chance to stun per 2% ignite chance.

This effects scales with bleed or poison if the Fissure is converted to physical or poison respectively.
reminderText: Ailment chance is counted before being converted.

ch0fs-23.name: Forbidden Chasm
description: The Fissure's initial hit now Curse enemies with {Acid Skin}, which causes them to take poison damage over time and a chance to be critically struck by any hit.

ch0fs-24.name: Acidbane
stats: +1% Bonus Crit Chance per 10% Inc Poison Damage
description:
Your hits against enemies cursed by {Acid Skin} have additional base critical strike chance per 10% of your global increased poison damage.

This bonus critical strike chance is not affected by other critical strike chance modifiers.

ch0fs-25.name: Ash Cloud
description: The Fissure's initial impact now spreads all of your ignite stacks from the target to nearby enemies up to a maximum.

ch0fs-26.name: Chthonic Passage
description:
When directly casting Chthonic Fissure you now travel along the Fissure as it opens, but this adds a cooldown to Chthonic Fissure.

Chthonic Fissure gains the {Traversal} tag.

ch0fs-27.name: Mantle of Flames
stats: 100% Your Ignite Chance -> Ignite Chance per Second
description:
The Fissure gains a percentage of your global chance to ignite on hit as ignite chance per second. 

Additionally, the Fissure has a base chance to ignite enemies each second.
reminderText:
This effect still applies even if Chthonic Fissure is converted.

For example your global bleed chance will be converted to bleed chance per second with the {Blood Gulch} node.

ch0fs-28.name: Blood Gulch
description:
Chthonic Fissure's base fire damage is converted to physical. Consequently this damage scales with increases to physical damage, but not increases to fire damage.

Ignite chance from all sources are converted to bleed chance per second for the Fissure.

Swaps Chthonic Fissures' {Fire} tag for a {Physical} tag.

ch0fs-29.name: Chronicles of Ruin
description: {Torment} lasts longer and any ignite, poison and bleed inflicted by Chthonic Fissure also last longer.

ch0fs-30.name: Tombgorger
description: {Torment} deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to ignited, poisoned or bleeding enemies.

ch0fs-31.name: Valley of Defilement
description:
Chthonic Fissure's base fire damage over time is converted to poison. Consequently this damage scales with increases to poison damage, but not increases to fire damage.

Ignite chance from all sources is converted to poison chance per second for the Fissure.

Swaps Chthonic Fissures' {Fire} tag for a {Poison} tag.
reminderText: This has no effect if Chthonic Fissure is converted to Physical with the {Blood Gulch} node.

ch4bo-1.name: Abrupt Chaos
description: Chaos Bolts has increased cast speed, and its projectiles travel faster.

ch4bo-2.name: Sanguine Reverie
description:
Chaos Bolts' base necrotic damage is converted to physical. Consequently this damage scales with increases to physical damage, but not increases to necrotic damage.

Damned chance from all sources are converted to bleed chance for Chaos Bolts.

Swaps Chaos Bolts' {Necrotic} tag for a {Physical} tag.

ch4bo-4.name: Scatter
description: Chaos Bolts' hits now have a chance to fear enemies, but the projectiles target a wider area.

ch4bo-6.name: Condemned to Chaos
description: Chaos Bolts' hits have a chance to inflict enemies with damned.

ch4bo-7.name: Blood Tithe
description: Chaos Bolts costs less mana, but now consumes a portion of your current health and ward on cast.

ch4bo-8.name: A Grave for Two
description: Chaos Bolts deals more damage over time (multiplicative with other modifiers) equal to a portion of your missing health.

ch4bo-9.name: The Gate
stats: Ailment Chances to Minions on Hit
description:
Hitting your minions with Chaos Bolts grants them any damned, ignite, bleed or frostbite chance that Chaos Bolts gains from this tree.

This buff lasts 10 seconds, and does not stack.

ch4bo-10.name: The Burn
description:
Directly casting Chaos Bolts extends the duration of your active {Cthonic Fissures} and {Infernal Shades}. 

This effect has a 3 second cooldown.

ch4bo-11.name: Exult in Misery
description: Chaos Bolts' hits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to damned, ignited, bleeding and frostbitten.
reminderText: Hitting enemies inflicted with multiple of these ailments, will cause the damage modifier to stack.

ch4bo-12.name: Mania in Flames
description: Chaos Bolts' hits have a chance to ignite enemies.

ch4bo-13.name: Call of Morditas
description:
Chaos Bolts' base fire damage is converted to cold. Consequently this damage scales with increases to cold damage, but not increases to fire damage. It now has a chance to freeze enemies.

Ignite chance from all sources are converted to frostbite chance for Chaos Bolts.

Swaps Chaos Bolts' {Fire} tag for a {Cold} tag.

ch4bo-14.name: Chance of Snow
stats: 6% Chance for Double Hit Damage against Chilled
description:
Chaos Bolts' hits have a chance to chill enemies. 

Additionally, Chaos Bolts' hits have a chance to deal double hit damage to chilled enemies.

ch4bo-15.name: Torment of the Red Tundra
stats: +6% Freeze Rate Multiplier per 1% Cold Res
+1% Physical Damage over Time per 4% Cold Res
description:
Chaos Bolts' hits have a higher chance to freeze enemies per 1% uncapped cold resistance.

Additionally, Chaos Bolts deals more physical damage over time (multiplicative with other modifiers) per 4% uncapped cold resistance.

ch4bo-16.name: Pandemonium
description: Chaos Bolts explosions have a chance to deal damage in a much large area.

ch4bo-17.name: Cthonic Aurora
description: Chaos Bolts releases additional projectiles, but it has a higher mana cost.

ch4bo-18.name: Mana Anarchy
description: Chaos Bolts' projectiles have a chance to consume additional mana causing it to deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ch4bo-19.name: Revolution
description:
Whenever mana is consumed by the {Mana Anarchy} node, your minions gain additional spell damage based on your maximum mana and they also gain increased cast speed.

This buff lasts 13 seconds.

ch4bo-20.name: Chains of the Betrayer
description:
Chaos Bolts no longer shoots multiple projectiles, but now instead shoots one large projectile causing it to deal more damage (multiplicative with other multipliers) in a larger area. 

These effects scale with the amount of projectiles Chaos Bolts would have shot.

ch4bo-21.name: Volatile Kindling
description: Chaos Bolts' hitting one of your {Volatile Zombies} causes it to instantly explode. Zombies exploding this way deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) in a larger area.

ch4bo-22.name: Sudden Putrescence
description: {Volatile Zombies} exploding from the {Volatile Kindling} node deal even more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) in a larger area and poisons enemies.

ch4bo-23.name: Destructive Intensity
description:
Whenever you cast Chaos Bolts you gain a stack of {Destructive Intensity} up to a maximum.

Each stack reduces the target area and improves Chaos Bolts base critical strike chance.

If you go 2 seconds without gaining a stack, all stacks are lost.

ch4bo-24.name: Doom's Vindication
description: Chaos Bolts deals more damage and its hits deal more damage to {Cursed} enemies (both multiplicative with other modifiers).

ch4bo-25.name: Reaper of Mayhem
description:
Chaos Bolts' hits have a chance per Dexterity to cause you to attack with {Harvest} from the location of enemies hit, hitting them and enemies around them.

This effect can occur a maximum of 3 times per second.

ch4bo-26.name: Devour the Damned
description: Chaos Bolts' hits against {Cursed} enemies regain health and mana.

ch4bo-27.name: Seed of Chaos
description:
Chaos Bolts' hits against {Cursed} enemies has a chance to cause you to recast Chaos Bolts from their location towards another nearby enemy, consuming a portion of its mana cost. 

The recast has a minimum range of 5 meters, and will not cast at enemies within that range.

ch4bo-28.name: Exacted Libation
description:
Chaos Bolts' hits have a chance per Intelligence to cast {Rip Blood} at target enemies.

This effect can occur a maximum of 2 times per second.

ch4bo-29.name: Cursed Blood
description: Chaos Bolts hits refreshes the duration of your {Curses} on them and grants you health per curse.

ch4bo-30.name: Another Affliction
description:
Chaos Bolts' hits against {Cursed} enemies casts {Bone Curse} at their location.

This effect has a 6 second cooldown.

dl73-2.name: Empowered Drain
description: Drain Life deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

dl73-3.name: Soul Blast
description: When a target is killed by Drain Life you cast Soul Blast at their location, dealing spell necrotic damage to enemies in an area around them.

dl73-4.name: Malignant Discharge
description: {Soul Blast} deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) in a larger area.

dl73-6.name: Hecatomb
description: Drain Life can now target your minions. You gain 10 mana per second for each minion you are draining.

dl73-7.name: Necrotic Feast
description: Drain Life can now only target minions. Drain Life leeches a higher percentage of damage as health.

dl73-8.name: Lay Waste
description: Drain Life deals significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but the health leech from its base effect and nodes on this tree is removed.

dl73-9.name: Soul Bond
description: Drain Life has a chance to summon a {Soul Wisp} when it kills an enemy, a minion that deals necrotic damage to enemies.

dl73-10.name: Virulence
description:
Drain Life's base necrotic damage is converted to poison damage. Consequently this damage scales with increases to poison damage, but not increases to necrotic damage.

Swaps Drain Life's {Necrotic} tag for a {Poison} tag.
reminderText: This also converts the explosion from the {Soul Blast} node to poison.

dl73-11.name: Blood Pact
description: Drain Life no longer costs mana. Instead, it drains a portion of your current health per second while channelling. Nodes that modify mana drain now modify this health drain instead.
reminderText:
Does not affect the up-front mana cost added by the {Dark Shackles} node.

Does not cause your mana to regenerate while channelling.

dl73-12.name: Death's Barrier
description: You are granted ward when Drain Life kills an enemy.

dl73-13.name: Horrify
description: Drain Life has a chance to slow and fear its targets each second.

dl73-14.name: Shadowy Tendril
description: Drain Life can drain an additional target.

dl73-15.name: Contempt
description:
You gain a stack of {Contempt} when you have channelled on the same enemy for 2 seconds.

Contempt grants more armour (multiplicative with other modifiers) and adds to all resistances. All stacks of Contempt are lost when you stop channelling.
reminderText: You can only gain 1 stack of Contempt from each enemy.

dl73-16.name: Enduring Contempt
description: {Contempt} stacks last for a duration after you stop channelling Drain Life.

dl73-17.name: Stagger
description: When Drain Life has channelled on the same target for 2 seconds, it stuns them for 2 seconds.

dl73-18.name: Stupefy
description: The stun inflicted by {Stagger} lasts longer and Drain Life deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) against bosses and rare enemies.

dl73-19.name: Thoughtsteal
description: Drain Life costs less mana per second.

dl73-20.name: Condemnation
description: Drain Life applies stacks of {Damned} each second. {Damned} is an ailment that deals necrotic damage over time.

dl73-21.name: Word Of Conviction
description: {Damned} inflicted by Drain Life lasts longer.

dl73-22.name: Eternal Servitude
stats: Wandering Spirits does not expire while channeling
description: If {Wandering Spirits} is active when you start channeling Drain Life it does not expire until you stop channeling.
reminderText: Individual spirits still expire as normal, but new ones keep being revealed.

dl73-23.name: Ravenous
description: Drain Life leeches a higher percentage of damage as health and deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to targets that are on low health.
reminderText: Low health is defined as below 35% of maximum health.

dl73-24.name: Insatiable
description: Drain Life leeches a higher percentage of damage as health, but costs more mana per second.

dl73-25.name: Dark Shackles
description: Drain Life is now cast instead of channelled. Lasts for 3 seconds. Adds an up-front mana cost, and this cost is affected by modifiers to mana drain, except for the {Blood Pact} node.

dl73-26.name: Enduring Night
description: {Dark Shackles} lasts longer, but Drain Life costs more mana.

dl73-27.name: Grasp Of The Damned
description: {Dark Shackles} can hit up to 10 additional targets, and slows enemies hit each second, but Drain Life costs significantly more mana.

dl73-28.name: Chilling Demise
description: When a target is killed by Drain Life, you chill enemies in an area around them for a duration.

dl73-30.name: Unholy Mass
description: Drain Life deals 3% more damage per stack of {Damned} on enemies affected by {Damned}, up to a cap (multiplicative with other modifiers).

dl73-32.name: Circle of Sacrifice
description:
You gain ward over time while channelling based on your maximum mana.

Drain Life can affect enemies in a wider area. This does not affect the maximum number of enemies you can drain from at a time.

dl73-33.name: Cloak of Solitude
stats: Increased Area Stats no longer affect Area
description: Increased Area stats from this tree and other sources has no effect on Drain Life's area of effect, but instead grants you additional Ward Retention while channelling Drain Life.

ds4d3-0.name: Dread Shade
description: Target minion takes 3% max health per second for each second the shade has been active, but it and minions around it deal 25% more damage. Each minion only benefits from one Dread Shade aura. Expires after 20 seconds. Max 4 active shades.

ds4d3-2.name: Wisdom of the Dead
description: Dread Shade costs less mana.

ds4d3-3.name: Martyrdom
description: Dread Shade now grants minions armor based on your vitality, but Dread Shade decays your minions faster.

ds4d3-4.name: Congregation of Shades
description: You can control one additional Dread Shade or Infernal Shade at once.

ds4d3-6.name: Frenzied Phantom
description: Dread Shade now grants frenzy to affected minions for a fixed duration after being cast.

ds4d3-7.name: Scorching Brand
description: Dread Shade now grants the targeted minion {Haste} while it persists, but it also applies a stack of ignite to the targeted minion each second.

ds4d3-8.name: Lingering Doom
description: Dread Shade drains your minions' health more slowly and all affected minions deal additional necrotic damage with spells and attacks.

ds4d3-9.name: Spectral Distance
description: Dread Shade affects a larger area, but buffs minions outside of the area instead.

ds4d3-10.name: Pernicious Pact
description: Dread Shade no longer decays your minions' health, but instead inflicts a stack of {Everlasting Poison} each second.
reminderText: Everlasting Poison is the same as Poison, but does not expire.

ds4d3-11.name: Doomed Wrath
description: When used on an {Abomination} or {Wraith}, Dread Shade grants that minion more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ds4d3-12.name: Egoism
description: The minion targeted by Dread Shade now always critically strikes, but Dread Shade now has a cooldown.

ds4d3-13.name: Deadlock
description: Dread Shade now roots the targeted minion and causes it to taunt enemies around it.

ds4d3-14.name: All For One
description: Dread Shade grants the targeted minion significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but Dread Shade no longer buffs other minions.

ds4d3-15.name: Blind Fury
description: Dread Shade now increases the attack and cast speed of the targeted minion, but they have less critical strike chance (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ds4d3-16.name: Dying Coven
description: Dread Shade grants affected minions increased attack and cast speed.

ds4d3-17.name: Duskheart
description: Minions affected by Dread Shade have a chance to inflict {Damned} to enemies they hit.

ds4d3-18.name: Dying Light
description: Dread Shade now inflicts {Damned} each second to all enemies and friendly minions in its area.

ds4d3-19.name: Spectral Presence
description: Dread Shade affects minions in a larger area.

ds4d3-20.name: Grim Fate
description: Dread Shade affects minions in a larger area and grants more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but the targeted minion's health decays more quickly.

ds4d3-21.name: Bane of Death
description:
Dread Shade applies {Mark for Death} to nearby enemies and minions when it expires.

Mark for Death is a curse that reduces all resistances by 25%. It cannot stack.

ds4d3-22.name: Final Grasp
description: When any of your minions targeted by Dread Shade dies, it casts {Sacrifice} on additional minions.

ds4d3-23.name: Enemy of My Enemies
description:
Dread Shade now attaches to enemies instead, still buffing your minions, but Dread Shade now has a shorter duration and this duration cannot be increased.

This does not buff or drain the health of enemies.

ds4d3-24.name: Symbiotic Apparition
description: You are affected by the beneficial buffs of Dread Shade's aura.
reminderText: For example you will not apply {Doom Brand} to yourself.

ds4d3-25.name: Doom Brand
description: Dread Shade now drains the health of other minions, and marks them with {Doom Brand}. When they die, the brand explodes dealing necrotic spell damage to surrounding enemies.
reminderText: Doom brand's explosion counts as your ability, not the minion's.

ds4d3-26.name: Dark Binding
description: {Doom Brand} deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ds4d3-27.name: Flesh Harvest
stats: 1% Increased Buff Effect Per 3% Missing Health
description: Dread Shade grants increased effect of all its buffs for each 3% of missing minion health.

ds4d3-28.name: Infernal Dread
stats: Refresh Infernal Shade Duration On Cast
description: Casting Dread Shade refreshes the duration of your {Infernal Shades.} Each Infernal Shade can only be refreshed a maximum number of times.

ds4d3-29.name: Dread Plague
description: Dread Shade applies {Spirit Plague} to a nearby enemy whenever it expires.

ds4d3-30.name: Beyond Death
description: When a minion targeted by a Dread Shade dies, you have a chance to summon a single {Volatile Zombie} from its corpse.

ds4d3-31.name: Lone Watcher
stats: Health Drain Increases -> increased Damage Taken
description: Dread Shade no longer drains the health of the minion it is attached to and lasts much longer, but you are a limited to one active Dread Shade. Increases to health drain from this tree instead increase damage taken by the minion.
reminderText: This does not affect your maximum number of infernal shades.

ds4d3-32.name: Vile Ghast
stats: 5% Poison Chance per 1 Added Necrotic Damage
description: Dread Shade now increases poison damage instead of necrotic damage, and converts added necrotic damage from the base skill and this tree to chance to poison on hit.

ds34l-0.name: Death Seal
description:
Combo skill. Seals your health at your current amount of health, draining your ward to 0 and preventing you from gaining health or ward for up to 5 seconds. For that duration you gain more damage equal to your percent missing health.

Reactivate to release a wave of death dealing damage based on how long the seal has been active, and percent missing health.

ds34l-2.name: Necrosis
description: For each point of ward consumed by Death Seal, the wave of death is granted a chance to shred enemy necrotic resistance.

ds34l-3.name: Leper's Skin
description: You gain necrotic resistance and armour for each point of ward consumed by Death Seal. This effect has a maximum for armour.

ds34l-4.name: Entreat The Damned
description: If {Wandering Spirits} is active when you activate Death Seal it is granted additional duration.
reminderText: This affects the duration for which new spirits are revealed not the duration of individual spirits.

ds34l-5.name: Corrupted Consciousness
description: For the duration of Death Seal, you gain increased damage based on the health you were missing when Death Seal was activated.

ds34l-6.name: Mortal Pulse
stats: Death Wave Cast Every Second While Sealed
description: You release a wave of death each second while sealed, in addition to when you release Death Seal, but your waves of death deal less damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ds34l-7.name: Tachycardia
stats: 60% Increased Wave of Death Crit Chance
description: You release waves of death more frequently while sealed and your waves of death have increased critical strike chance.

ds34l-8.name: Desperate Shroud
description: For the duration of Death Seal, you gain armor and stun avoidance for each 10 health you were missing when Death Seal was activated.

ds34l-9.name: Life Tap
description: If you drop below 10% health while you are sealed, Death Seal is released automatically.
reminderText: This node does nothing when cast on a minion.

ds34l-10.name: Grim Scale
description: Death Seal now drains health while sealed, and you have increased mana regeneration while sealed.

ds34l-11.name: Deadlock
description: If your health is above 33% of your maximum when you activate Death Seal, it is reduced to 33% of your maximum health.

ds34l-12.name: Pustulent Presence
stats: 1% Global Poison Chance Per 3% Missing Health
description: While sealed, your spells and attacks have a chance to poison enemies for each percent of health you are missing when Death Seal is activated.

ds34l-13.name: Cycle of Decay
stats: +20% Death Wave Hit Damage To Poisoned Enemies
description: Wave of death hits deal more damage against poisoned targets (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ds34l-14.name: Curdled Flesh
stats: +2% Death Wave Hit Damage Per Poison
description: Wave of death hits deal more damage per stack of poison up to a maximum (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: This effect is multiplicative with other modifiers

ds34l-15.name: Carrion Breath
description: Wave of death deals damage in a larger area.

ds34l-16.name: Lethal Release
description: Wave of death deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ds34l-17.name: Sanguine Wave
description: Wave of death hits now leech a portion of the damage they deal as health based on the duration you have remained sealed.

ds34l-18.name: Corporeal Cascade
description: Wave of death's base damage is converted to physical. Consequently this damage scales with increases to physical damage, but not increases to necrotic damage.

ds34l-19.name: Skeletal Sheath
description: When you release Death Seal, you are granted {Bone Armor}, which grants less damage taken for the duration that Death Seal was active.

ds34l-20.name: Condemnation
description: Death Seal's waves of death instantly kill enemies that are below a health threshold.

ds34l-21.name: Blood Bond
description: Minions hit by a wave of death deal more damage for 4 seconds (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ds34l-22.name: Soul Stability
description: Death Seal prevents health loss from effects that continously drain a percentage of your current health.
reminderText: This does not affect health drain effects from abilities like Reaper Form.

ds34l-23.name: The Quick And The Dead
description: When you release Death Seal, you are granted {Haste} for the duration that Death Seal was active.

ds34l-24.name: Flesh Pact
description:
When you release Death Seal, you gain an amount of health for each second Death Seal was active.

Death Seal no longer releases waves of death.

ds34l-25.name: Doomcall
stats: +10% Death Wave Damage Per Damned Stack
description: You gain a stack of {Damned} for each second you remain sealed. Waves of death hits now deal more damage per stack of Damned on you (multiplicative with other modifiers), and you are cleansed of all Damned stacks when you release Death Seal.
reminderText: This damage modifier for Wave of Death if multiplicative with other modifiers.

ds34l-26.name: Moratorium
description: Death Seal has a higher maximum duration.

ds34l-27.name: Seal of Servitude
description: Death Seal now targets only minions.

ds34l-28.name: Frenzied Accord
description: When used on a minion, Death Seal also grants it more damage and critical strike chance (both multiplicative with other modifiers).

ds34l-29.name: Death Stranded
description: Minions targeted by Death Seal are rooted in place for its duration. When Death Seal is released, the minion explodes in addition to releasing the wave of death at its location.

ds34l-30.name: Devouring Release
description: You now repeatedly cast {Hungering Souls} while you are sealed. Hungering Souls cast this way has a 70% chance to have only 1 projectile.

ds34l-31.name: Insatiable Soul
description: You release {Hungering Souls} more frequently.

fe8at-1.name: Hunger
description: Soul Feast has increased cast speed and costs less mana.

fe8at-2.name: Grand Imprint
description: Soul Feast no longer requires targets to be {Cursed} and no longer has a target limit, but now hits all enemies a small cone in front of you.

fe8at-3.name: Winds of Affliction
description: Soul Feast deals damage in a larger area and has a chance to apply {Frailty} on hit.

fe8at-4.name: Grim Affliction
description: Soul Feast deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but {Soul Fragments} grant less ward.

fe8at-5.name: Infernal Hunger
stats: 1 Extra Casts per Stack of Infernal Hunger
description: If you go 2 seconds without directly casting Soul Feast you gain a stack of {Infernal Hunger}. When you next cast Soul Feast directly, all stacks of {Infernal Hunger} are consumed to cast Soul Feast an additional time per stack.
reminderText: Average number of recasts is equal to the number of points in the node.

fe8at-6.name: Waning Life
description: Damned inflicted by Soul Feast has additional necrotic penetration.
reminderText: This increases both the damage of Damned and its reduction to health regen.

fe8at-7.name: Sharpened Influence
description: Soul Feast costs less mana and can hit more targets.

fe8at-8.name: Poisoned Husks
description: Soul Feast's hits have a chance to poison enemies on hit.

fe8at-9.name: Diseased Soul
description: Casting Soul Feast grant you a chance to poison enemies with all hits for 4 seconds, but also inflicts you with poison. This buff cannot stack.

fe8at-10.name: Toxic Craving
description:
Soul Feast consumes poison stacks you applied on the target, granting you more armor (multiplicative with other modifiers) and additional poison resistance per stack.

This buff lasts 6 seconds and can stack a maximum number of times.

Poison stacks applied by minions or other party members are not cleansed and are not counted for the buff.
reminderText: The armour modifiers from individual stacks are not multiplicative with each other, just with all armour modifiers from other sources.

fe8at-11.name: Soul Seeker
description: {Soul Fragments} grant additional ward based on your intelligence.
reminderText: The effect of this node is not rounded. If it granted you 1 ward additional ward per 25 intelligence, but you only had 10 intelligence, it would grant 0.4 additional ward.

fe8at-12.name: Blood Feast
description:
Soul Feast's base necrotic damage is converted to physical damage. Consequently this damage scales with increases to physical damage, but not increases to necrotic damage.

{Soul Fragments} now restore health instead of granting ward. The health restored is equal to the ward you would have been granted.

fe8at-13.name: Incision
stats: +1% Physical Ailment Damage per 100 Missing Health
description:
Soul Feast has a chance to cause enemies to bleed.

Physical ailments inflicted by Soul Feast deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) based on your missing health.

fe8at-14.name: Blood Tethers
description: Soul Feast has a chance to cast {Blood Tether} on enemies it hits.
reminderText:
{Blood Tether} is a spell that attaches to an enemy, drawing blood from them to deal physical damage over time. 25% of the damage dealt is leeched as health.

An enemy cannot have more than one tether at a time. Tethers last 5 seconds.

fe8at-15.name: Blood from Souls
description: When you kill an enemy with Soul Feast it has a chance to create a {Blood Splatter} around the target.

fe8at-16.name: Hellmind
description: Soul Feast has additional chance to inflict damned on hit based on your Intelligence.

fe8at-17.name: No Rest for the Wicked
stats: 13% Minion Frenzy Chance On Damned Kills
description: When you kill a damned enemy with Soul Feast, you have a chance to grant your minions {Frenzy} for 3 seconds.

fe8at-18.name: Original Sin
stats: Marks For Death to reach threshold
description: If the number of cursed enemies within 15 meters is at or below a threshold shortly after you cast Soul Feast, then a number of enemies within that range are {Marked for Death} to reach that threshold of cursed enemies.
reminderText: For example if the threshold is 6 and only 2 cursed enemies remain in the area after casting Soul Feast up to 4 other enemies in the area will be Marked for Death.

fe8at-19.name: Bones of the Accursed
description: For each {Curse} on the target, Soul Feast hits grant more ward and deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

fe8at-20.name: Wrest
stats: +85% Ward Granted From Rares Or Bosses
description: {Soul Fragments} from bosses or rare enemies grant significantly more ward.

fe8at-21.name: Usurp
stats: 6 Mana Granted From Rares Or Bosses
description: {Soul Fragments} from rare or boss enemies also grant you mana. Modifiers to the amount of ward granted by Soul Fragments also apply to the amount of mana gained from this node.

fe8at-22.name: Queen of Flies
description:
When you hit a poisoned enemy with Soul Feast it spreads all stacks of your stacks of poison from that enemy to a number of other enemies within 5 metres.

Has no effect if you have the {Toxic Craving} node.

fe8at-23.name: Engorged
stats: 1% Greater Fragment Chance per 10 Current Mana
description: Soul Feast costs less mana and has a chance based on your current mana to draw back {Greater Soul Fragments}, which grant more ward (multiplicative with other modifiers).

fe8at-24.name: Another Strife
description: When Soul Feast hits an enemy {Cursed} with {Spirit Plague}, {Decrepify}, {Marked for Death}, or {Penance} it spreads those {Cursed} from that enemy to a number of other enemies within 5 metres.
reminderText: This does not spread {Curses} that the enemy hit by Soul Feast is not afflicted by.

fe8at-25.name: Celerity
description: {Soul Fragments} return to you faster and Soul Feast has a chance to grant you {Haste} for 4 seconds.

fe8at-26.name: Crimson Bounty
description: Soul Feast can hit more targets.

fe8at-27.name: Withering Maw
description: Soul Feast inflicts {Withering} on hit, an ailment which increases the curse damage taken.

fe8at-28.name: Thought Corrosion
stats: Poison Self on Cast -> Armor Shred
description:
Poison Chance from all sources is converted to armor shred for Soul Feast and armor shred applied by Soul Feast has increased effect.

The {Diseased Soul} node now inflicts you with armor shred on cast instead of poison.

gh0fl-1.name: Dread Furnace
description: Ghostflame has a chance to inflict damned and ignite enemies each second.

gh0fl-2.name: Arteries of Malice
description:
Ghostflames's base necrotic and fire damage is converted to physical. Consequently this damage scales with increases to physical damage, but not increases to necrotic or fire damage.

Damned and ignite chance from all sources are converted to bleed chance per second.

Ghostflame now drains a portion of your health each second.

Swaps Ghostflames's {Necrotic} and {Fire} tags for a {Physical} tag.

gh0fl-3.name: Phantom Transfusion
stats: 50% Bleed Chance -> Bleed Chance per second
description:
You leech a portion of the physical damage you deal as health while channeling Ghostflame.

A portion of your global bleed chance on hit now applies as bleed chance per second for Ghostflame.

gh0fl-4.name: Feast of Bones
stats: 1 Max Marrow Shards per second against 1 target
description:
Damaging an enemy with Ghostflame causes you to cast {Marrow Shards} towards them.

This effect can occur a maximum number of times each second.

gh0fl-5.name: Fuel of Anguish
description:
Increases the frequency of {Marrow Shards} per second from the {Feast of Bones} node.

Improves the {Marrow Shards'} base critical strike chance cast this way.

gh0fl-6.name: Occult Embers
description: Ghostflame has increased ignite and damned duration per point of Intelligence.

gh0fl-7.name: Flames of Misery
stats: 40% Ignite Chance -> Ignite Chance per second
60% Damned Chance -> Damned Chance per second
description:
