A portion of your global ignite chance on hit now applies as ignite chance per second for Ghostflame.

A portion of your global damned chance on hit now applies as damned chance per second for Ghostflame.

gh0fl-8.name: Decrepit Mortals
description:
After channelling Ghostflame for a short duration, the skull releases a terrible screech, cursing all nearby enemies with {Decrepify}.

Ghost Flame gains the {Curse} tag, but its direct damage still does not scale with increased curse damage.

gh0fl-9.name: Horrifying Shriek
description: The screech from the {Decrepit Mortals} node has a shorter delay before being released and a larger area.

gh0fl-10.name: Banshee
description: The screech from the {Decrepit Mortals} node now also fears enemies and Ghostflame deals more direct damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to feared enemies.
reminderText: Direct damage modifiers do not affect damage of ailments and subskills from Ghostflame.

gh0fl-11.name: Atrocity
description: Ghostflame deals more damage, but has a higher channel cost (both multiplicative with other modifiers).

gh0fl-12.name: Disdain
description: You take less damage from ignited, damned or bleeding enemies while channeling Ghostflame, but it costs more mana to channel.

gh0fl-13.name: Domain of Torment
description: Ghostflame deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) in a larger area.

gh0fl-14.name: Enfeebled Prey
description:
You leech a portion of the damage you deal as health against {Cursed} enemies while channeling Ghostflame.

Additionally, Ghostflame has a chance to inflict Frailty each second.

gh0fl-15.name: Lingering Warmth
stats: 15 Ward Gain per Cursed enemy after Channeling
description:
When you stop channeling Ghostflame after having channeled for at least 1 second, you gain the {Haste} buff for a short duration.

Additionally, when you stop channeling you gain ward per {Cursed} enemy.

gh0fl-16.name: Memorial of Flames
description:
After channeling for 1.1 seconds Ghostflame detaches itself, and persists for short duration without you needing to channel.

This effect ends early if you start channeling Ghostflame again.

gh0fl-17.name: Unending Ruin
description: The duration from the {Memorial of Flames} node is longer, but Ghostflame now has an upfront mana cost.

gh0fl-18.name: The Burning Skull
description: The detached Ghostflame now slowly seeks out nearby enemies.

gh0fl-19.name: Silver Oblation
description: After channeling for 1 second, Ghostflame consumes a portion of your current ward, and it deals damage in a larger area per ward consumed.

gh0fl-20.name: Stygian Beams
description:
For each 200 ward consumed by the {Silver Oblation} node you now cast a {Stygian Beam} at a nearby enemy dealing spell necrotic damage.

Enemies cannot be hit by more than 1 beam.

gh0fl-21.name: Spirit Kindling
stats: 2% Current Health Drain per second per stack
30% Ignite Chance -> Minion Ignite Chance per stack
description:
All your {Wraiths}, {Spectres}, and {Revenants} gain a stack of {Spirit Kindling} every 0.5 seconds while they are inside Ghostflame's area of effect.

Each stack of {Spirit Kindling} lasts 5 seconds, drains health per second, and grants increased movement speed, melee attack speed, and ignite chance equal to a portion of your ignite chance.

gh0fl-22.name: Fiery Desecration
description: Ghostflame now deals damage in a full circle around you, but it has a higher channel cost.

gh0fl-23.name: Spirit of Dread
description: You now move towards the target location while channeling Ghostflame with increased movement speed, but it has a higher channel cost.

gh0fl-24.name: Harrowing Path
description: Ghostflame has a lower channel cost, but you move slower while channeling Ghostflame.

gh0fl-25.name: Doom Surge
description: You move faster while channeling Ghostflame.

gh0fl-26.name: Domain of Agony
description: Ghostflame deals more direct damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per second you spend channeling Ghostflame.
reminderText: Direct damage modifiers do not affect damage of ailments and subskills from Ghostflame.

gh0fl-27.name: Spectral Menace
stats: 14% Current Mana -> Ward Gain while Channeling
description: Ghostflame has a lower channel cost and you gain a portion of your current mana as ward each second while channeling Ghostflame.

gh0fl-28.name: Wraith Form
stats: +1 Dodge Rating per Intelligence while Channeling
description: You gain additional dodge rating per intelligence while channeling Ghostflame, as well as more dodge rating (multiplicative with other modifiers) while channeling Ghostflame.

gh0fl-29.name: Ethereal Blockade
description: All of your dodge rating is converted to armor while channeling Ghostflame.

ha84-2.name: Harrowing Blade
description: Harvest hits have a chance to reduce enemy necrotic resistance.

ha84-3.name: Life Eater
stats: 1 Health Gained Per Point Of Intelligence
description:
Harvest grants you health each time it hits a cursed enemy.

Health gained scales with your intelligence stat.

ha84-4.name: Mark of the Locust
description: When Harvest hits a target afflicted by Spirit Plague, it applies Withering and has a chance to spread Spirit Plague to an additional target.

ha84-5.name: Great Scythe
description: Harvest deals damage in a larger area.

ha84-6.name: Spectral Whetstone
description: Improves Harvest's base critical strike chance.

ha84-7.name: Learned Weakness
description: You have increased critical strike chance if you have hit a cursed enemy with Harvest recently (past 4 seconds).

ha84-8.name: Steal Youth
description: You have more movement speed if you have landed a critical strike with Harvest recently (past 4 seconds).

ha84-9.name: Symbol of Loss
description: Harvest hits deal more damage against Cursed enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ha84-10.name: Mind Harvest
description: Harvest grants you ward when it hits a Cursed enemy.

ha84-11.name: Mirror Soul
stats: 1% Percent Of Health Granted As Ward
description: Harvest grants you ward based on your maximum health when it hits a Cursed enemy.

ha84-12.name: Ghost Conduit
description: Ward granted by this skill tree is also granted to your minions.

ha84-13.name: Undead Veins
description: Your minions are granted more ward from Harvest.

ha84-14.name: Putrid Reaper
description: Harvest hits have a chance to poison enemies.

ha84-15.name: Death Inside
description: Harvest hits deal more damage per stack of poison on the target (multiplicative with other modifiers) up to a maximum

ha84-16.name: Crimson Death
description:
Harvest's base necrotic damage is converted to physical. Consequently this damage scales with increases to physical damage, but not increases to necrotic damage.

Harvest now gains bleed chance per point of intelligence instead of added melee necrotic damage.

Swaps Harvest's {Necrotic} tag for a {Physical} tag.

ha84-17.name: Blood Bringer
description: Harvest has a chance to cause enemies to bleed.

ha84-18.name: Double Edged Scythe
description:
When you hit an enemy with Harvest both you and the enemy are inflicted with bleed. Bleed stacks on enemies inflicted by Harvest have additional Physical Penetration.

The self-inflicted bleed does not scale with your stats.

ha84-19.name: Wraith Skin
description: Harvest consumes all of your remaining mana on use, and you gain ward equal to twice the mana consumed.

ha84-20.name: Iron Mouths
description: Improves Harvest's base critical strike chance., but also costs health to use.

ha84-21.name: Legion of the Lich
description: Minions have increased critical strike chance if you have landed a critical strike with Harvest recently (past 4 seconds).

ha84-22.name: Finality
description: Harvest hits instantly kill enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health).
reminderText: If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

ha84-23.name: Spirit Shards
description:
Each hit with Harvest grants a {Spirit Shard} up to a total of 13. When you have 13 Spirit Shards your next use of Harvest consumes them to deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and grant you mana.

Consuming Spirit Shards also grants your existing minions more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) for 4 seconds. This buff does not stack.

ha84-24.name: Undead Harvest
description: Harvest hits leave a trace on enemies, causing enemies to take increased damage and be prioritized by your minions. Traces last for 5 seconds.

ha84-25.name: Blood Sculptor
description: Harvest has a chance to summon a {Blood Spectre} when it kills an enemy. You cannot summon more than one Blood Spectre every 2 seconds.
reminderText: {Blood Spectres} have a base of 100 health, decay over time, and use melee attacks.

ha84-26.name: Red Reapers
description: {Blood Spectres} summoned by Harvest have a significantly increased critical strike chance.
reminderText: {Blood Spectres} have a base of 100 health, decay over time, and use melee attacks.

ha84-27.name: Spectral Feast
description: {Blood Spectres} summoned by Harvest leech a signficant portion of the damage they deal as health.
reminderText: {Blood Spectres} have a base of 100 health, decay over time, and use melee attacks.

ha84-28.name: Necrotic Blood
description: {Blood Spectres} summoned by Harvest deal additional melee necrotic damage.
reminderText: {Blood Spectres} have a base of 100 health, decay over time, and use melee attacks.

hs18gu-2.name: Forbidden Pact
description: Souls deal additional spell damage based on your maximum mana, but fewer Souls are created with each cast.

hs18gu-3.name: Isolation
description: Souls are significantly larger and deal more hit damage, but only one is created with each cast.

hs18gu-4.name: Piercing Gaze
description: Improves Hungering Souls' base critical strike chance.

hs18gu-5.name: Hungering Eyes
description: Souls' critical strikes deal more damage.

hs18gu-6.name: Great Soul
description: Souls are larger and deal more hit damage, but Hungering Souls costs more mana.

hs18gu-7.name: Soul Drain
stats: 10% Chance To Grant Mana On Kill
description: Souls have a chance to grant you mana when they kill an enemy.

hs18gu-8.name: Mind Harvest
description: Souls grant you more mana when they kill an enemy.

hs18gu-9.name: Focused Wrath
description: Hungering Souls fires projectiles in a narrower cone.

hs18gu-10.name: Caustic Wretches
description: Souls have a chance to poison enemies.

hs18gu-11.name: Decayed Mind
description: Souls have an increased chance to poison enemies, and they cost less mana.

hs18gu-12.name: Inspired Hunger
description: Directly casting Hungering Souls causes you to deal more damage over time against Possessed Enemies for 8 seconds. This effect does not stack.
reminderText: This grants more damage over time against enemies afflicted with Spreading Flames instead of Possessed Enemies if Hungering Souls is converted to Fire.

hs18gu-13.name: Risen Cemetery
description: Hungering Souls has a chance to fire additional projectiles.

hs18gu-14.name: Soul Swarm
description: Hungering Souls fires additional projectiles, but costs more mana.

hs18gu-15.name: Dominion Of Undeath
description: Hungering Souls costs less mana, and fires projectiles in a wider cone.

hs18gu-16.name: Life Hunt
description: Hungering Souls has increased cast speed and its souls travel faster, causing them to go further before they expire.

hs18gu-17.name: Reaper's Gaze
description:
Souls hits instantly kill enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health). 

If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

hs18gu-18.name: Ravenous
description: Souls deal additional necrotic damage on Hit.

hs18gu-19.name: Vengeful Souls
stats: 7% Chance To Cast Hungering Souls When Hit
70% Chance for Single Projectile When Hit
description: You have a chance to cast Hungering Souls when hit, but Souls cast this way have a 70% chance to only have one projectile.

hs18gu-20.name: Soul Catcher
description: Hungering Souls cost less mana and has a chance to grant ward on kill.

hs18gu-21.name: Lament
stats: +3% Chance To Cast Hungering Souls When Hit
description:
You have a higher chance to cast Hungering Souls when hit.

When you directly cast Hungering Souls you gain Ward.

hs18gu-22.name: Risen Hatred
stats: +4% Chance To Cast Hungering Souls When Hit
description:
You have a higher chance to cast Hungering Souls when hit.

When you directly cast Hungering Souls you have a chance to cast it twice in quick succession.

hs18gu-23.name: Grave Bond
description: Souls deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) if you have at least one minion.

hs18gu-24.name: Necromantic Emanation
description: Souls deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) for each minion you have.

hs18gu-25.name: Unholy Trinity
description: Souls deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) if you have exactly three minions.

hs18gu-27.name: Fire Skull
description:
Hungering Souls' base damage is increased and converted to fire and its hits ignite instead of possessing. Consequently this damage scales with increases to fire damage, but not increases to necrotic damage.

Souls deal more hit damage.

hs18gu-28.name: Eternal Pyre
description: Ignites inflicted by Hungering Souls last longer and have additional Fire Penetration

hs18gu-29.name: Descent Into Madness
description: Souls deal more damage over time (multiplicative with other modifiers).

is40-0.name: Infernal Shade
description: Target enemy and all nearby enemies take fire damage per second . Each enemy can only have one Infernal Shade attached at a time. Expires after 5 seconds. Max 4 active shades.
reminderText:
Added spell damage applies at 100% effectiveness each second.

Your maximum number of shades is shared with Dread Shade.

is40-1.name: Ignition
description: Infernal Shade costs less mana and has increased cast speed.

is40-2.name: Blaze Shade
stats: +200% Area of Effect with Blaze Shade
description: You have a chance to create a {Blaze Shade} which deals more damage in a significantly larger area (multiplicative with other modifiers).

is40-3.name: Fleeting Shade
description: {Blaze Shade} deals more damage, but has a shorter duration (multiplicative with other modifiers).

is40-4.name: Fanning the Flames
description: Infernal Shade deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) in a larger area.

is40-5.name: Lingering Flames
description: If no target is within range of your target location the shade will wait up to 10 seconds for a target to come within range and then attach to it.
reminderText: This node has no effect if the Hellfire node is taken.

is40-6.name: Purgatory
description: Infernal Shade gains 15% fire penetration each second that it is unattached to a target.
reminderText: If you have the Blood Shade node this grants physical penetration instead.

is40-7.name: Legion
description:
When directly casting Infernal Shade you will create extra shades if there are nearby enemies.

Infernal Shade costs more mana to cast.

Has no effect if you have taken the Hellfire node.

is40-8.name: Wildfires
description: Infernal Shade deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but has reduced duration.

is40-9.name: Combustion
description: When Infernal Shade expires there is a large explosion which deals fire damage to nearby enemies.

is40-10.name: Fiery Conclusion
description: The explosion which occurs when the Infernal Shade expires deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and affects a larger area.

is40-11.name: Flame Burst
description: Infernal Shade has reduce duration and the explosion which occurs when the Infernal Shade expires has added critical strike chance.
reminderText: This duration reduction is additive wih the reduction from the Wildfires node.

is40-12.name: Heart of Fire
description: Infernal Shade deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but in a smaller area.

is40-13.name: Cackling Flames
description: Infernal Shade has increased duration.

is40-14.name: Brimstone
description: Infernal Shade has a chance to slow nearby enemies each second.

is40-15.name: Hellfire
description:
Infernal Shade is now ground targeted and cannot attach to any targets.

Infernal Shade applies a stack of Fire Resistance Shred each second but now has a cooldown.

Prevents additional Shades from the Legion node being created.

is40-16.name: Fiend Hunter
description: Infernal Shade has a shorter cooldown.

is40-17.name: Flight of Fire
description: You can cast an additional Infernal Shade or Dread Shade.

is40-18.name: Shifting Doom
description: When Infernal Shade's target dies it has a chance to move to a new target.

is40-19.name: Influence
description: Infernal Shade deals damage in a larger area.

is40-20.name: Devour in Flames
description: Infernal Shade can now only attach to your minions, but your minions are also damaged by Infernal Shade.

is40-21.name: Burn Trail
description: Your minions gain {Haste} while they have an Infernal Shade attached to them.

is40-22.name: Subjugation
description: Infernal Shade deals more direct damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) for each second it has been active, up to a maximum.

is40-23.name: Soulfire
description: Infernal Shades which attach to minions have unlimited increased duration.

is40-24.name: Manic Pyre
description: Minions which have an Infernal Shade attached to them gain increased movement, attack and cast speed each second up to a maximum.

is40-25.name: Torment Beacon
description: Infernal Shade has a chance to ignite nearby enemies each second.

is40-26.name: Baneful
description: Ignited inflicted by Infernal Shade has additional Fire Penetration

is40-27.name: Blood Shade
description:
Infernal Shade's base fire damage is converted to physical. Consequently this damage scales with increases to physical damage, but not increases to fire damage.

All ignite chance from this tree is converted to bleed chance and effects related to ignite now depend on bleed instead.

is40-28.name: Corrosion
description: Infernal Shade has a chance to shred the armor of nearby enemies each second.

pr5fm-2.name: Discourage
description: Profane Veil's area has a chance to slow enemies each second. Additionally, you leech a portion of the global damage you deal as health while in Profane Veil.

pr5fm-3.name: Heretic's Flame
description:
Profane Veil's base necrotic damage is converted to fire. Consequently this damage scales with increases to fire damage, but not increases to necrotic damage.

Profane Form now has a chance to ignite enemies each second.

Swaps Profane Form's {Necrotic} tag for a {Fire} tag.

pr5fm-4.name: Hell Fire
description: While in Profane Veil you gain a percentage of your damned, bleed, poison, slow and ignite chance on hit as chance to ignite per second for Profane Form.

pr5fm-5.name: Propane Form
description:
You move faster equal to a portion of your chance to ignite on hit up to a maximum, but Profane Veil has a shorter duration per chance to ignite on hit up to a maximum.

Profane Veil gains the {Traversal} tag.

pr5fm-6.name: Infernal Deliverance
description:
When you first damage an enemy with Profane Veil you have a chance to cast {Infernal Shade} on them.

This effect can occur a maximum amount of times per cast of Profane Veil.

pr5fm-7.name: Mire of Words
stats: +1 Chill stacks on Cursed Rares and Bosses
description: Profane Veil Immobilizes {Cursed} enemies for a short duration, but Bosses and Rare enemies will instead be chilled, rather than Immobilized.

pr5fm-8.name: Scorn
description: You deal more global damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to {Cursed} enemies while in Profane Veil.

pr5fm-9.name: Stream of Profanity
description:
Directly casting a {Curse} skill reduces Profane Veil's remaining cooldown.

This effect can occur a maximum number of times.

pr5fm-10.name: Sable Inquisition
description: Profane Veil affects a larger area.

pr5fm-11.name: Profane Instruments
description:
Profane Veil gains additional effects depending on the weapon type you are wielding. 

{Staff}: Increased area.
{Wand}: More damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).
{Scepter}: Increased duration.
{Dagger}: Increased movement speed.
{Axe}: Kill threshold.

pr5fm-12.name: Visage of Terror
description: You now fear nearby enemies for a short duration when you exit Profane Veil. Additionally, Profane Veil deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to feared or slowed enemies for the same duration.

pr5fm-13.name: Spirit Plate
description: Damage reduction from armor now also applies to damage over time taken while in Profane Veil.

pr5fm-14.name: Seance
stats: 1 Ward Gain per 15% Uncapped Necrotic Res
description:
When a {Wandering Spirit} is revealed inside Profane Veil's area the {Spirit} deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) in a larger area for the rest of the {Spirit's} duration. 

Additionally, for each {Spirit} revealed inside Profane Veil's area you gain ward scaling with your necrotic resistance.

pr5fm-15.name: Derision
stats: 2 Ward Gain on Dodge per Dex
description: You gain ward per dexterity when you dodge while in Profane Veil.

pr5fm-16.name: Eternal Blasphemy
description: Profane Veil lasts longer and you move faster while in it.

pr5fm-17.name: Singleminded
description:
While in Profane Veil you move faster and it has a shorter cooldown, but you can no longer change direction while concealed and it has a shorter duration without being able to extend its duration.

Profane Veil gains the {Traversal} tag.

pr5fm-18.name: Vampiric Pool
stats: 3% Portion of Minion health to Ward Gain
description: Profane Veil's area now consumes your minions, and consuming minions this way grants you ward equal to a portion of their maximum health as well as extending its remaining duration by a small amount.

pr5fm-19.name: Apocalypse
description:
You now summon {Volatile Zombies} when you exit Profane Veil equal to the number of minions consumed up to a maximum from the {Vampiric Pool} node.

{Zombies} summoned deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) in a larger area per Intelligence.

pr5fm-20.name: Omnivore
description:
The benefits from the {Vampiric Pool} and {Apocalypse} nodes now also trigger when you kill enemies with Profane Veil.

The limit from {Vampiric Pool} remains the same.

pr5fm-21.name: Lake of Blood
description:
Profane Veil's base necrotic damage is converted to physical. Consequently this damage scales with increases to physical damage, but not increases to necrotic damage.

Profane Veil deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per 10% global Bleed chance on hit.

Swaps Profane Veil's {Necrotic} tag for a {Physical} tag.

pr5fm-22.name: Desecrated Graves
stats: Bone Curse on you on Enter or Exit
Bone Curse at Target Location with Forked Tongue
description: You now cast {Bone Curse} when you enter and exit Profane Veil.
reminderText: If you have the {Forked Tongue} node then this also casts {Bone Curse} at the second area.

pr5fm-23.name: Forked Tongue
description: You now create a secondary Profane Veil area that is detached from you and moves towards enemies, but Profane Veil now has a higher mana cost.
reminderText: The secondary area has the same movespeed as you, enemies can be damaged by both areas at once and it ends the end at the same time.

pr5fm-24.name: Second Rites
description: The secondary area from {Forked Tongue} is now created at the target location, but Profane Veil costs additional mana.

pr5fm-25.name: Harsh Words
description: Profane Veil costs less mana and deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

pr5fm-26.name: Grave Circle
description: Profane Veil's area now applies {Mark for Death} to enemies, but entering Profane Veil applies {Mark for Death} to you.

pr5fm-27.name: Mark of the Rat
stats: Damned Spreads with Mark for Death
Poison Spreads with Mark for Death
description: When you apply {Mark for Death} to an enemy or yourself by any method, all your stacks of damned and poison on them spread to a number of nearby enemies.

pr5fm-28.name: Profane Orbs
description: While in Profane Veil, you consume 6 mana to cast a {Profane Orb} each second that seek out enemies.
reminderText: The Orb is affected by damage conversion nodes.

pr5fm-29.name: Hex Flurry
stats: +1% Profane Orb Frequency per 1% Cast Speed
description: Increases the frequency of {Profane Orb} per 1% increased cast speed for {Curses} you have. Additionally, {Profane Orb} deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per {Curse} on the target.
reminderText: This includes global cast speed.

pr5fm-30.name: Loose Tongue
description: Profane Veil costs less mana.

pr5fm-31.name: Penitent Tangent
stats: +5% Penance Damage per 1% of Damage Reflected
description: Profane Veil's area inflicts {Penance} to enemies, which is a {Curse} that causes enemies to take fire damage when they hit a target. Additionally Penance deals more damage per 1% of Damage Reflected (multiplicative with other modifiers).

pr5fm-32.name: Unholy Renewal
description: You now cleanse all negative ailments on you when you enter Profane Veil.

rb31pl-0.name: Rip Blood
description: Rips blood out of a target enemy dealing physical damage to it. A {Blood Orb} is drawn back to you which restores 10 health when it reaches you.

rb31pl-2.name: Splatter
description: Rip Blood hits have a chance to create a {Blood Splatter} at the target, dealing damage to other enemies around it, but not the original target.
reminderText:
Nodes on this tree do not apply to {Blood Splatter} unless stated otherwise.

Hitting or killing an enemy with {Blood Splatter} does not count as hitting or killing an enemy with Rip Blood.

If you have more than 100% chance to cause {Blood Splatter} you can cause multiple {Blood Splatters}.

rb31pl-3.name: Eviscerate
description:
Rip Blood has a significantly higher chance to make a {Blood Splatter}, but costs more mana.

This {Blood Splatter} can not occur if you are out of mana.
reminderText:
Nodes on this tree do not apply to {Blood Splatter} unless stated otherwise.

Hitting or killing an enemy with {Blood Splatter} does not count as hitting or killing an enemy with Rip Blood.

If you have more than 100% chance to cause {Blood Splatter} you can cause multiple {Blood Splatters}. The second {Blood Splatter} can hit the original target and targets hit by the first splatter.

rb31pl-4.name: Crimson Flood
description: {Blood Splatter} deals damage in a larger area.

rb31pl-5.name: Revile
description: {Blood Splatter} deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and have an increased chance to stun enemies.

rb31pl-6.name: Coagulation
description: When a blood orb grants excess health above your maximum, you gain a stack of {Coagulated Blood}. Upon reaching 4 stacks, your next Rip Blood will consume all stacks to form a {Coagulated Blood Orb} that seeks out a nearby enemy, dealing spell physical damage in a small area.
reminderText:
This node has no effect if Rip Blood grants ward instead of health.
You can not have more than 4 stacks of Coagulated Blood.

rb31pl-8.name: Varicose Veins
description: The {Coagulated Blood Orb} deals more damage in a larger area (multiplicative with other modifiers).

rb31pl-12.name: Blood Infusion
description: {Blood Splatter} grants your minions {Blood Infusion} when it hits them. The {Blood Infusion} buff grants 15% more damage for 4 seconds (multiplicative with other modifiers).

rb31pl-13.name: Necrotic Unity
description: Blood Splatter has increased area for each minion you currently control.

rb31pl-14.name: Infused Frenzy
description: {Blood Infusion} grants increased attack and cast speed.
reminderText: {Blood Infusion} grants 15% more damage for 4 seconds (multiplicative with other modifiers).

rb31pl-15.name: Hemophagy
description: {Blood Infusion} causes your minions to leech a portion of the physical damage they deal as health.
reminderText: {Blood Infusion} grants 15% more damage for 4 seconds (multiplicative with other modifiers).

rb31pl-16.name: Hemomancer
description: Rip Blood has increased cast speed.

rb31pl-17.name: Thirst
description: Rip Blood costs less mana and has increased cast speed.

rb31pl-18.name: Carrion Hunger
description: When you are out of mana Rip Blood is free.

rb31pl-19.name: Quenching
description: {Blood Orbs} grant additional health and the {Blood Orb} returns faster.

rb31pl-20.name: Hematology
description: {Blood Orbs} restore more health based on your Intelligence stat.

rb31pl-21.name: Mana Feast
description: {Blood Orbs} now also grant you mana when you directly cast Rip Blood.

rb31pl-22.name: Marrow Drinker
description: Rip Blood can be cast on your minions, but no longer can be cast on enemies. {Blood Orbs} restore significantly more health.

rb31pl-23.name: Gushing Wound
description: Rip Blood hits have a chance to cause enemies to bleed.

rb31pl-24.name: Septic Wound
description: Bleed chance granted by the {Gushing Wounds} node is converted to poison chance.

rb31pl-25.name: Septic Blood
description: {Blood Splatter} has a chance to poison enemies.

rb31pl-26.name: Arcane Absorption
description: When you directly cast Rip Blood and hit at least one enemy you gain additional spell damage for 6 seconds. This effect can stack.

rb31pl-27.name: Run Dry
description: Rip Blood deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

rb31pl-28.name: Necrotic Inspiration
description: Rip Blood deals more damage for each minion you currently control (multiplicative with other modifiers).

rb31pl-29.name: Blood Catalyst
description:
Rip Blood will automatically cast itself on a nearby enemy if it kills an enemy, but no longer creates {Blood Orbs}.

This effect can repeat and chain to other enemies. This effect cannot trigger if you are out of mana.

rb31pl-30.name: Rip Spirit
description: Rip Blood's and {Blood Splatter's} base physical damage is converted to necrotic damage. Consequently this damage scales with increases to necrotic damage, but not increases to physical damage.

rb31pl-31.name: Arcane Fortress
description:
{Blood Orbs} now grant ward instead of health, equal to half of the health they would have restored.

Being at or close to full health does not affect the amount of the ward the {Blood Orbs} grant.
reminderText: This ward gain is not affected by healing effectiveness.

rb31pl-32.name: Stench of Blood
description: Rip Blood has increased cast speed leaves a stench on the target enemy that causes your minions to prioritise attacking it.

rf1azz-2.name: Soul for a Soul
description: While in Reaper Form, you deal increased damage but have reduced healing effectiveness.

rf1azz-3.name: Ghastly Flow
description: You move faster for 4 seconds after using {Reap} while below half health.

rf1azz-4.name: Sanguine Reaper
description: {Reap} deals damage in a larger area and you leech a portion of the damage its hits deal as health.

rf1azz-5.name: Ravenous Doom
description: While in Reaper Form you gain health from kills. This bonus is doubled for kills using {Reap}.

rf1azz-6.name: Reaper's Curse
description: While in Reaper Form, you deal increased damage and have increased critical strike chance, but lose health when you kill an enemy.

rf1azz-7.name: Death's Door
stats: +1% Reap Damage Per Missing Health Percent
description: {Reap} deal more damage for each percent of health you are missing (multiplicative with other modifiers). You deal increased damage at low health while in Reaper Form.
reminderText: You are at low health when your current health is below 35% of your maximum health.

rf1azz-8.name: Dark Harvest
description: {Reap} hits instantly kill enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health).
reminderText: If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

rf1azz-9.name: Gravechill
stats: Reap Necrotic Damage per Intelligence -> Cold
description:
All of {Reap}'s base damage and its added melee damage from intelligence are converted to cold. Consequently this damage scales with increases to cold damage, but not increases to necrotic damage.

Poison chance from all sources is converted to {Chill} for Reap, and Reap gains a freeze rate equal to four times your intelligence.

Reap loses its {Necrotic} and {Poison} tags and gains a {Cold} tag instead.

rf1azz-10.name: Deathtouch Scythe
description: While in Reaper Form, you deal additional necrotic damage. This bonus is doubled for {Reap}.

rf1azz-11.name: Executioner
description: While in Reaper Form, your critical strikes deal more damage. This bonus is doubled for {Reap}.

rf1azz-12.name: Bloodmoon Reaver
description:
All of {Reap}'s base damage and its added melee damage from intelligence are converted to physical. Consequently this damage scales with increases to physical damage, but not increases to necrotic damage. You have additional physical penetration while in Reaper Form.

All poison related effects from this tree now affect bleed for Reap.

Reap loses its {Necrotic} tag and gains a {Physical} tag instead.
reminderText: This node has no effect if you have taken the {Gravechill} node.

rf1azz-13.name: Sweeping Scythes
description: {Reap} moves you further.

rf1azz-14.name: Pestilence
description: Reap poisons enemies, but cannot critically strike. It also gains the {Poison} tag.
reminderText: This node has no effect if you have taken the {Gravechill} or {Bloodmoon Reaver} nodes.

rf1azz-15.name: Venomous Coating
description: {Reap} has a chance to poison enemies, and poisons you inflict while in Reaper Form last longer.

rf1azz-16.name: Herald of Rot
stats: 1 Poison Stacks To Nearby Enemies On Transform
description: Entering Reaper Form poisons all nearby enemies. While in Reaper Form, you have a chance to poison enemies that you hit.

rf1azz-17.name: Haunting
description: While in Reaper Form, you have a chance apply {Mark For Death} to enemies on hit. This chance is doubled for {Reap}.

rf1azz-18.name: Rapid Destruction
description: You have increased attack, cast speed and movement speed while in Reaper Form.

rf1azz-19.name: Reaper's Ascendance
description: Gain a stack of {Reaperâ€™s Ascendance} every 5 seconds you spend in Reaper Form, which grants you increased spell damage. You can have up to 25 stacks of Reaperâ€™s Ascendance at a time.

rf1azz-20.name: Reaper's Supremacy
description: You gain stacks of Reaperâ€™s Ascendence more frequently.

rf1azz-21.name: Mistress of Decay
description: While in Reaper Form, your health decays more slowly and you deal increased damage over time.

rf1azz-22.name: Soul Shroud
description: While in Reaper Form, you gain additional armor proportional to your intelligence.

rf1azz-23.name: Elixir of Death
description: While in Reaper Form, potions grant twice as much health as normal.

rf1azz-24.name: Vile Shroud
stats: +1% Necrotic Resistance Per Point Of Intelligence
+1% Poison Resistance Per Point Of Intelligence
description: While in Reaper Form, you gain additional necrotic and poison resistance per point of intelligence.

rf1azz-25.name: Phantom Restoration
description: While in Reaper Form, you have more ward retention. {Reap} grants ward on hit.

rf1azz-26.name: Protective Spirit
description: {Reaperâ€™s Blessing} also grants ward when you transform back to your human form.

rf1azz-27.name: From the Grave
description: Entering Reaper Form summons {Skeletons}, unless you are already at your maximum number of Skeletons.
reminderText: The skeletons summoned are the same as those summoned with the Summon Skeleton skill, and all of its nodes still apply.

rf1azz-28.name: Reaper's Blessing
description: You gain ward when entering Reaper Form.

rf1azz-29.name: Mercy in Undeath
description: Hitting minions with {Reap} heals them for the same amount that Reap would heal you if an enemy was hit.

rf1azz-30.name: Soul Release
description: You have a chance to cast {Hungering Souls} whenever you kill an enemy with {Reap}.

rf1azz-31.name: Harbinger of Blood
description: While in Reaper Form you have increased healing effectiveness and leech more of the damage you deal. You gain additional health on hit with {Reap}.

rf1azz-32.name: Unholy Dominion
stats: Reap and Transplant no longer share a cooldown
description: {Reap} has a much longer cooldown, but no longer shares a cooldown with {Transplant}.

rf1azz-33.name: Swift Harbinger
description: {Reap} has increased cooldown recovery speed.

rf1azz-34.name: Blood Tethers
stats: 6% Chance To Cast Blood Tether When Hit
description: While in Reaper Form, you have a chance to retaliate with {Blood Tether} when you are hit.
reminderText:
{Blood Tether} is a spell that attaches to an enemy, drawing blood from them to deal physical damage over time. 25% of the damage dealt is leeched as health.

An enemy cannot have more than one tether at a time. Tethers last 5 seconds.

sf31rc-2.name: Soul Shatter
description: Sacrifice deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but Sacrifice costs more mana.

sf31rc-3.name: Great Sacrifice
description: Sacrifice deals significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) if the sacrificed minion has more current health than you.
reminderText: You monster.

sf31rc-4.name: Last Sacrifice
description: Sacrifice deals significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) if the minion you sacrifice is your only active minion.

sf31rc-5.name: Altar of Flames
description: Sacrifice deals additional fire damage.

sf31rc-6.name: Infernal Vindication
description: Sacrifice costs less mana and if you cast Sacrifice while you control at least one minion you gain a buff that grants you more damage over time (multiplicative with other modifiers). This buff does not stack.

sf31rc-7.name: Burning Offering
description: Sacrifice has a chance to ignite enemies and ignite it inflicts has additional fire penetration.

sf31rc-8.name: Punishment
description: Sacrifice deals more damage against bleeding enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

sf31rc-9.name: Pontifex
description: Sacrifice deals more damage for each minion your currently control (multiplicative with other modifiers).

sf31rc-10.name: Blood Spectre
description:
When you sacrifice a minion you have a chance to assemble a {Blood Spectre} from the remains. 15 mana is consumed when you summon a Blood Spectre. 

You cannot summon a Blood Spectre by sacrificing a Blood Spectre or when your mana is negative and below -100.
reminderText: {Blood Spectres} have a base of 100 health, decay over time, and use melee attacks.

sf31rc-11.name: Blood Weaver
description: {Blood Spectres} have a chance to cause enemies to bleed. Blood Spectres consume less mana when summoned.
reminderText: {Blood Spectres} have a base of 100 health, decay over time, and use melee attacks.

sf31rc-12.name: From Blood
description: {Blood Spectres} summoned by Sacrifice have more maximum health and deal more damage (both multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: {Blood Spectres} have a base of 100 health, decay over time, and use melee attacks.

sf31rc-13.name: Crimson Horror
description:
Sacrificing a minion always creates a {Blood Spectre}.

Blood Spectres summoned by Sacrifice have significantly more maximum health and damage (both multiplicative with other modifiers), and are larger, but consume more mana when summoned.

sf31rc-14.name: Hemophage
description: {Blood Spectres} leech a portion of the damage they deal as health. Sacrifice has a greater chance to summon a Blood Spectre.
reminderText: {Blood Spectres} have a base of 100 health, decay over time, and use melee attacks.

sf31rc-15.name: Bone Nova
description: Sacrificing a minion creates a {Bone Nova} around it, but Sacrifice costs more mana.

sf31rc-16.name: Bone Missiles
description: {Bone Nova} projectiles travel faster, causing them to travel further.

sf31rc-17.name: Impaling
description: {Bone Nova} deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

sf31rc-18.name: Ivory Ballista
description: {Bone Nova} projectiles pierce (continue through targets they hit).

sf31rc-19.name: Lacerating Bones
description: {Bone Nova} hits have a chance to cause enemies to bleed.

sf31rc-20.name: Avatar of Decay
description: You deal increased damage over time if you have cast Sacrifice recently (past 4 seconds). You cannot have multiple instances of this buff at once.

sf31rc-21.name: Temple of Awe
description: Sacrifice deals damage in a larger area and has an increased chance to stun enemies.

sf31rc-22.name: Necrotic Audience
description: Sacrifice deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) in a larger area if you have three or more minions active when you cast Sacrifice.

sf31rc-23.name: Catalyst of Horror
description: Sacrifice is recast onto other minions within its area of effect, which can happen multiple times. Sacrifice costs more mana.

sf31rc-24.name: Sanguine Libation
description: Sacrifice is recast onto other minions within its area of effect up to one additional time. It also has additional Bleed Chance.

sf31rc-25.name: Flickering Shadows
description: If you cast Sacrifice while you control at least one minion all your active {Infernal Shades} have their remaining duration reduced to 2 seconds, but deal significantly more damage for their remaining duration.
reminderText:
This damage bonus stacks. The stacks are not multiplicative with each other, but are multiplicative with other modifiers.

This only affects Infernal Shades' regular damage over time effect, not any ailments they apply or sub skills they trigger.

Infernal Shades that have less than 2 seconds remaining duration do not have their duration changed, but still gain the damage bonus.

sm4g-1.name: Gravetide
description: Skeletal Mages deal additional spell damage.

sm4g-2.name: Macabre Waltz
description: Skeletal Mages can cast {Profane Oblation} on your melee Wraiths and Blood Spectres, sacrificing them to deal necrotic damage to surrounding enemies.
reminderText: Skeletal Mages will not sacrifice Putrid Wraiths or Flame Wraiths.

sm4g-3.name: Underlings
description: Skeletal Mages can cast {Profane Oblation} on your Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Vanguards, sacrificing them to deal necrotic damage to surrounding enemies.

sm4g-4.name: Cryomancers
description:
Adds {Cryomancers} to the pool of Skeletal Mages that can be summoned. Cryomancers deal cold damage and cast {Ice Shard}.

All poison chance gained from this tree is converted to chill chance for Cryomancers.
reminderText: Cyromancers count as Skeletal Mages and receive all of the bonuses they do.

sm4g-5.name: Frost Lich
description: Removes regular Skeletal Mages and Pyromancers from the pool of Skeletal Mages that can be summoned, and your Skeletal Mages deal increased damage.

sm4g-6.name: Frozen Tomb
description: Skeletal Mages have an increased chance to stun enemies and an increased freeze rate.

sm4g-7.name: Putrid Essence
description: Skeletal Mage hits have a chance to poison enemies.

sm4g-8.name: Ossein Frenzy
description: Skeletal Mages have a chance to gain {Frenzy} for 3 seconds when they hit an enemy.

sm4g-9.name: Pyromancers
description:
Adds Pyromancers to the summon pool of Skeletal Mages that can be summoned. Pyromancers deal fire damage and cast {Fireball}.
 
All poison chance gained from this tree is converted to ignite chance for Pyromancers.
reminderText: Pyromancers count as Skeletal Mages and receive all of the bonuses they do.

sm4g-10.name: Inferno
description: Your Skeletal Mages have increased health, but regular Skeletal Mages are removed from the summon pool of Skeletal Mages.

sm4g-11.name: Flame Rot
description: Ignites and poisons inflicted by Skeletal Mages last longer and have additional Penetration.

sm4g-12.name: Celer Mortis
description: Improves Skeletal Mages' base critical strike chance and they move faster.

sm4g-13.name: Grey Merchant
description: Skeletal Mages' critical strikes deal more damage, and when they critically strike they are healed for a percentage of their maximum health.

sm4g-14.name: Order of Death
description: You can summon more Skeletal Mages.

sm4g-15.name: Leech Life
description: Skeletal Mages leech a portion of the damage they deal as health and have increased maximum health.

sm4g-16.name: Death Knights
description: Adds Death Knights to the summon pool of Skeletal Mages, which uses melee necrotic attacks, and removes all other types of Skeletal Mages from the pool.
reminderText:
Death Knights count as Skeletal Mages and receive all of the bonuses they do.

The area of the Death Knights' melee attacks is affected by Increased Area for Minion Area Skills stats.

sm4g-17.name: Flaming Attacks
description: Death Knight melee hits deal additional fire damage.

sm4g-18.name: Death Blossom
description: Death Knights cast {Hungering Souls} with additional projectiles. Hungering Souls has an 8 second cooldown when cast by Death Knights.

sm4g-19.name: Undead Mortars
description: Skeletal Mages cast {Necrotic Mortar}, a ranged necrotic spell with a large area of effect. Necrotic Mortar has a 6 second cooldown.
reminderText: The area of the mortar is affected by Increased Area for Minion Area Skills stats.

sm4g-20.name: Battle Hardened
description: Skeletal Mages are able to use their abilities more frequently.

sm4g-21.name: Splintered Dominion
description:
Skeletal Mages have a chance to fire 2 additional projectiles. 

Skeletal Mages have an increased area of effect with melee attacks.

sm4g-22.name: Archmage
description: You can only summon one Skeletal Mage, an Archmage, that has significantly more maximum health and damage (both multiplicative with other modifiers), fires twice the number of extra projectiles, and is larger.
reminderText:
The Archmage can be any type of Skeletal Mage or Death Knight.

The modifiers to damage and health are multiplicative with other modifiers.

sm4g-23.name: Argonautic Speed
description: Skeletal Mages attack and cast faster (multiplicative with other modifiers).

sm4g-24.name: Shadow Wardens
description: Skeletal Mages' gain ward over time and have a chance to avoid critical strikes.

sm4g-26.name: Forbidden Arcana
description: Skeletal Mages deal more damage based on your maximum mana.

sm4g-27.name: Grave Passage
description: When you directly cast Summon Skeletal Mage you are teleported to the target location. Summon Skeletal Mage now has a cooldown and counts as {Traversal} skill.
reminderText: Using a Traversal skill puts all other traversal skills on cooldown and traversal skills' cooldowns do not recover while you are using a traversal skill.

sm4g-28.name: Death's Cavalry
description: When you teleport using Summon Skeletal Mage some of your other minions are teleported with you.
reminderText: Immobile minions cannot be teleported.

sp5g2-0.name: Spirit Plague
description: Curses a target with a powerful necrotic damage over time effect. Spreads to a single nearby target on target death.

sp5g2-2.name: Hindering Affliction
description: Enemies afflicted by Spirit Plague are now also slowed.

sp5g2-3.name: Plague Burst
stats: +10% Chance To Spread On Hitting Afflicted Enemy
description: You have a chance to spread Spirit Plague when you hit an afflicted enemy.

sp5g2-4.name: Putrid Recovery
description: You gain ward when hitting an enemy afflicted by Spirit Plague.

sp5g2-5.name: Agonizing Expanse
stats: Plague Spreads On Crit Against Afflicted Target
description: Spirit Plague spreads when you critically strike an afflicted target.

sp5g2-6.name: Enfeeblement
description: Enemies you inflict with Spirit Plague are also inflicted with Frailty.

sp5g2-7.name: Contagion
description: Spirit Plague is now cast in an area around the target, but costs more mana.

sp5g2-8.name: Plague's Purview
description: Spirit Plague is cast in a larger area.

sp5g2-9.name: Scourge
description: Spirit Plague deals significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but no longer spreads.

sp5g2-10.name: Plague of Eyes
description: Spirit Plague has additional spell necrotic damage for each point of Intelligence

sp5g2-11.name: Toxic Transmission
description: Enemies you inflict with Spirit Plague are also inflicted with poison for the same duration.

sp5g2-12.name: Gift of Death
description: Spirit Plague has a chance to summon a {Poison Wisp} when it kills an enemy, a minion which lasts for 15 seconds and poisons nearby enemies.

sp5g2-13.name: Efficacious Application
description: Spirit Plague costs less mana and lasts longer.

sp5g2-14.name: Discharge
description: Spirit Plague spreads after a duration. (This does not affect the maximum number of spreads.)

sp5g2-15.name: Perpetuity
description: Spirit Plague has increased cast speed and lasts longer.

sp5g2-16.name: Spooked
description: Enemies afflicted by Spirit Plague are also feared.

sp5g2-17.name: Conductor of Plagues
description: Spirit Plague is now a combo skill. Directly recasting Spirit Plague within 2 seconds will cause up to 3 inflicted enemies to spread Spirit Plague to other enemies around them.

sp5g2-18.name: Pestilence
description: You gain increased global damage over time when you afflict an enemy with Spirit Plague. This effect lasts 4 seconds and can stack up to 13 times.

sp5g2-19.name: Plague Bearer
description: Enemies you inflict with Spirit Plague are also inflicted by {Plague} for the same duration. {Plague} is an ailment that deals poison damage over time, spreads between enemies, and does not stack.

sp5g2-20.name: Queen of Plagues
description: {Plague} inflicted by Spirit Plague has additional Poison Penetration.

sp5g2-21.name: Endless Decay
description: You gain increased poison damage when you afflict an enemy with Spirit Plague. This effect lasts 4 seconds and can stack up to 13 times.

sp5g2-22.name: Rotten to the Core
description: Spirit Plague deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

sp5g2-23.name: Concentrated Rot
description: Spirit Plague deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but spreads in a smaller area.

sp5g2-24.name: Calamitous
description: Spirit Plague spreads to additional targets, but costs more mana.

sp5g2-25.name: Hemorrhage
description: Enemies you inflict with Spirit Plague are also inflicted with bleeding for the same duration.

sp5g2-26.name: Exsanguination
description: Bleed inflicted by Spirit Plague has additional Bleed Penetration, but you are now also inflicted with bleeding.

sp5g2-27.name: Defilement
description: You gain mana when Spirit Plague kills an enemy.

sp5g2-28.name: Laceration
stats: 30% Chance To Bleed Afflicted Enemies On Hit
description: You have a chance to apply bleed when you hit an enemy afflicted by Spirit Plague.

ss37kl-0.name: Summon Skeleton
reminderText: Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-2.name: Necrotic Conviction
description: Skeleton Warriors have more maximum health, while Skeleton Rogues and Archers deal more damage (all multiplicative with other modifiers).

ss37kl-3.name: Aegis of Death
description: When one of your Skeletons dies, another Skeleton is healed to full health.
reminderText: Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-4.name: Unbound Necromancy
description: Summon Skeletons costs less mana, and your Skeletons have improved base critical strike chance.
reminderText: Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-5.name: Soul Catcher
description: You gain ward whenever one of your Skeletons dies.
reminderText:
Skeletons that are unsummoned do not trigger this effect.

Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-6.name: Mind Catcher
description: You gain mana whenever one of your Skeletons dies.
reminderText:
Skeletons that are unsummoned do not trigger this effect.

Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-7.name: Memory Catcher
description: You have increased spell damage if one of your Skeletons has died recently (past 4 seconds).
reminderText:
Skeletons that are unsummoned do not trigger this effect.

Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-8.name: Unholy Rage
description: Skeletons have increased attack speed, cast speed, and movement speed.
reminderText: Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-9.name: Lone Guardian
description: Your Skeletons have increased critical strike chance, but you can only have one Skeleton Warrior summoned at once.
reminderText:
This does not affect your overall Skeleton limit.

Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-10.name: Mightier than the Sword
description: Skeleton Warriors are removed from the pool of Skeletons that can be summoned.

ss37kl-11.name: Marrow Walkers
description: You can summon more Skeletons.
reminderText: Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-12.name: Hollow Walkers
description: You can summon more Skeletons.
reminderText: Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-13.name: Grave Walkers
description: You can summon more Skeletons.
reminderText: Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-14.name: Shambling Steel
description: Skeleton Archers are removed from the pool of Skeletons that can be summoned.

ss37kl-15.name: Fire Arrow
description: Skeleton Archers use {Fire Arrow}, which is a bow attack that deals physical and fire damage and ignites on hit. Fire Arrow has a 6 second cooldown by default.

ss37kl-16.name: Multishot
description: {Fire Arrow} shoots more arrows that deal more bow damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but has a longer cooldown.
reminderText: {Fire Arrow} has a 6 second cooldown by default.

ss37kl-17.name: Ice Arrow
description: Converts {Fire Arrow} into {Ice Arrow}, converting its base fire damage to cold damage. Ice Arrow cannot ignite, but has a chance to freeze.
reminderText: The freeze rate of {Ice Arrow} increases by 6% per point of intelligence. All nodes which affect Fire Arrow affect Ice Arrow instead.

ss37kl-18.name: Dread Phalanx
description: Skeletons deal more damage and have more health (both multiplicative with other modifiers) and are larger, but you can only summon half as many as you could before (rounded up).
reminderText:
More damage is multiplicative with other modifiers.

Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-19.name: Bone Armor
description:
Skeleton Warriors can now cast {Bone Armor} for 4 seconds, which grants less damage taken (multiplicative with other modifiers).

This effect has a 4 second cooldown.

ss37kl-21.name: Bone Share
description: Skeleton Warriors can target allies with {Bone Armor}.
reminderText: Allies refers to you, your minions, and your party members and their minions.

ss37kl-22.name: Marrow Tap
description: Skeletons leech a portion of the damage they deal as health and they have additional physical resistance.
reminderText: Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-23.name: Empty the Graves
description: You summon multiple Skeletons in a single cast, but Summon Skeleton costs more mana. This does not affect your maximum number of Skeletons.
reminderText:
This does not increase your maximum number of total Skeletons that you can have active at one time. This allows you to summon them simultaniously.

Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-24.name: Sweeping Strikes
description: Skeletons have an increased area of effect with melee attacks, and your Skeletons deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-25.name: Skeleton Rogue
description: Adds Skeleton Rogues to the pool of Skeletons that can be summoned. Rogues dash to distant enemies, throw shurikens, use melee attacks, and they poison enemies on hit.
reminderText:
Their dash ability has an 8 second cooldown by default.

Shurikens has a 4 second cooldown by default, and can store 2 charges.

ss37kl-26.name: Immortal
description: When a Skeleton dies, there is a chance to summon a random new one at the same location after 3 seconds.
reminderText:
The new Skeleton will be a random one of the types active on this tree.

Skeletons refers to Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Rogues, and Skeleton Warriors.

ss37kl-27.name: Vile Flask
description: Skeleton Rogues can now throw an {Vile Flask}, which inflicts poison and armor shred on hit. Vile Flask has a 5 second cooldown.
reminderText: The area of effect of Skeleton Rogues' Vile Flask is affected by Increased Area for Minion Area Skills stats.

ss37kl-28.name: Individual Operator
description: Skeleton Rogues gain more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and increased cooldown recovery speed, but the amount is divided by your maximum number of summonable Skeleton Rogues.
reminderText:
Your limit for each type of Skeleton is equal to your maximum number of Skeletons divided by how many types of Skeletons you have enabled, rounded up.

For example if you can summon just Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Rogues and can summon up to 7 skeletons, then your maximum number of Skeleton Rogues is 7/2 which is 3.5 which is rounded up to 4.

svz81-0.name: Volatile Zombie
description: Summons a Volatile Zombie which shambles towards an enemy and explodes.

svz81-1.name: Leap Attack
description: Zombies now leap towards their targets, up to a maximum distance.

svz81-2.name: Fervor
description: Zombies deal more damage and have more movement speed (both multiplicative with other modifiers).

svz81-3.name: Grave Attunement
description: Zombies deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and the Zombies' health decays slower, but they also move slower.

svz81-4.name: Giant Zombie
stats: 10% Chance to Summon from Indirect Casts
description: You now summon a single large zombie with more health, that deals more damage in a larger area (all multiplicative with other modifiers), but Volatile Zombie costs more mana.
reminderText: Both the area and damage modifiers also affect {Repulsive Vomit}.

svz81-6.name: Corrosive Guts
description: {Vomit} has a chance to shred enemy armor each second.

svz81-7.name: Bone Pact
stats: No Health Cost For Marrow Shards
description:
When a Zombie dies you have a chance to cast {Marrow Shards} from the Zombie towards a nearby enemy.

Marrow Shards does not cost health when cast this way.

svz81-8.name: Repulsive Vomit
description: Zombies will now {Vomit} on enemies before exploding, dealing physical and poison damage over time. Zombies lose 33% of their maximum health per second while vomiting.
reminderText:
The damage of the vomit can be converted by the {Flammable Vitae} and {Horrific Vessels} nodes.

The area of effect of the vomit is not affected by Increased Area for Minion Area Skills stats.

svz81-9.name: Corpse Bane
stats: Mark For Death On Explosion Hit
description: The explosion applies {Mark for Death} to enemies hit, but Volatile Zombie costs more mana.

svz81-10.name: Dreadful Horde
stats: 10% Chance to For Additional Zombies from Indirect Casts
description: You summon additional Zombies per cast, but Volatile Zombie costs more mana and has additional cooldown duration.

svz81-11.name: Wretched Innards
description: {Vomit} deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

svz81-12.name: Army of Rot
description: The explosion has a chance to poison enemies.

svz81-14.name: Path of Destruction
description: The explosion deals damage in a larger area.

svz81-15.name: Shepherd of Thralls
description: The explosion deals damage in a larger area and when a Zombie dies it creates a {Skeleton Vanguard}, but Volatile Zombie costs more mana.

svz81-16.name: Putridity
description: {Vomit} has a chance to poison enemies each second.

svz81-17.name: Vile Force
description: When a Zombie dies it creates {Corpse Parasites} for 4 seconds, but Volatile Zombie costs more mana.

svz81-18.name: Rite of the Grave
description: The explosion deals damage in a larger area, but Zombies no longer move.

svz81-19.name: Grand Sacrifice
description:
When a Zombie dies you have a chance to cast {Sacrifice} on another nearby minion.

Sacrifice cast this way costs less mana.

svz81-20.name: Forceful Commander
description: You summon Zombies faster and Volatile Zombie costs less mana.

svz81-21.name: Necromantic Fervor
description:
You are healed for a portion of the Zombies' maximum health when they explode. 

The amount healed is affected by your increased healing effectiveness.
reminderText: As an example, if the Zombie has 1000 max health, you are healed for 10 health when it explodes.

svz81-22.name: Flammable Vitae
description:
The explosion's base physical damage and {Vomit}'s base physical and poison damage are converted to fire. Consequently their damage scales with increases to fire damage, but not increases to physical or poison damage.

Poison chance from all sources is converted to ignite chance and effects related to poison now depend on ignite instead.
reminderText: No effect if you have taken {Horrific Vessels}.

svz81-23.name: Horrific Vessels
description: The explosion's base physical and fire damage and {Vomit}'s base physical damage are converted to necrotic. Consequently their damage scales with increases to necrotic damage, but not increases to physical or fire damage.

svz81-24.name: Pull of the Grave
description:
Zombies instantly kill enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health).

If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

svz81-25.name: Army of Nightmares
description: The explosion now fears enemies for a short duration.
reminderText: Fear causes enemies to flee from you and your allies. Enemies can only be affected by Fear once.

svz81-26.name: Effigy of Combustion
description:
When a Zombie dies you have a chance to cast {Infernal Shade} on an enemy near the zombie.

Infernal Shade cast this way costs less mana.
reminderText: Infernal Shade is a spell that causes the target enemy and all nearby enemies take fire damage per second.

svz81-27.name: Ferocious Horde
description: Zombies have increased movement speed per point of missing health, but their health decays faster.

svz81-28.name: Ravenous
stats: +30% Hit Damage to Bosses And Rare Enemies
description: The explosion's hit deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) against bosses and rare enemies.

svz81-29.name: Daunting Blast
description: The explosion has an increased chance to stun enemies.

svz81-31.name: Awakening Presence
stats: +10% Chance to Cast Volatile Zombie On Minion Death
description: When a minion dies you have a chance to cast Volatile Zombie at its location, expending its mana cost.
reminderText:
This cannot be triggered by Zombies or Corpse Parasites.
This cannot summon more than 1 Zombie.

svz81-32.name: Vital Ward
stats: Health -> Ward From Zombie Max Health
description: {Necromantic Fervor} now grants ward rather than health. The amount of ward gained is not affected by increased healing effectiveness.

sw42ih-2.name: Locus Of Resurrection
description: {Wraiths} appear at the target location, but Summon Wraith costs more mana.

sw42ih-3.name: Locus Of Death
description: {Wraiths} deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and have increased melee attack speed, but are unable to move.

sw42ih-4.name: Dark Scythe
description: {Wraiths} have more melee attack speed (multiplicative with other modifers).

sw42ih-5.name: Echoes Inside
description: Summon Wraith summons three additional {Wraiths} with each cast, but Summon Wraith also costs more mana and now has a cooldown.

sw42ih-6.name: Stygian River
description: Summon Wraith has a shorter cooldown, and there is a shorter delay between each {Wraith} being summoned.

sw42ih-7.name: Army of Wraiths
description: Summon Wraith summons additional {Wraiths} per cast, but costs more mana.

sw42ih-8.name: Spectral Ambush
description: Removes the delay between each {Wraith} being summoned, but fewer Wraiths are summoned per cast (rounded up).

sw42ih-9.name: Haunting
description: {Wraiths} have more maximum health (multiplicative with other modifiers).

sw42ih-10.name: Twin Spirits
description: {Wraiths'} health no longer decays, but you are limited to only 2 wraiths.
reminderText: Effects which increase your maximum wraiths do not apply if you have this node.

sw42ih-11.name: Sanguine Spirits
description: Bleed inflicted by {Wraiths} has increased effect and duration.
reminderText: Increased bleed effect increases the damage of bleed multiplicatively with other modifiers, but additively with other sources of increased bleed effect.

sw42ih-12.name: Sequel of Avarice
description: {Wraiths} are larger, deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), and hit a larger area with their melee attacks.

sw42ih-13.name: Covenant of Souls
description: You can control more {Wraiths} at once.
reminderText: This node has no effect if you have the Twin Spirits node.

sw42ih-14.name: Reapers
description: {Wraiths} deal additional necrotic damage with attacks and spells.

sw42ih-15.name: Wraith Bringer
description: Summon Wraith has increased cast speed and costs less mana.

sw42ih-16.name: Fallen Reclamation
description: {Wraiths} move faster.

sw42ih-17.name: Flame Wraith
description: You have a chance to instead summon a {Flame Wraith}, which casts fireballs. Additionally all {Wraiths} deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

sw42ih-18.name: Spirit Link
description: {Wraiths} have improved base critical strike chance, and when you cast Summon Wraith you gain increased critical strike chance equal to its mana cost for 4 seconds.

sw42ih-19.name: Dawn of the Fall
description: {Wraiths} have additional critical strike chance and leech a portion of the damage they deal with crits as health

sw42ih-20.name: Dusk of the Living
description: {Wraiths'} critical strikes deal more damage.

sw42ih-21.name: Necrotic Hunger
description: {Wraiths} deal more necrotic damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), and leech a portion of the necrotic damage they deal as health.

sw42ih-22.name: Grave Reality
description: {Wraiths} have more maximum health (multiplicative with other modifiers), but Summon Wraith costs more mana and has reduced cast speed.
reminderText: The health bonus is multiplicative with other modifiers.

sw42ih-23.name: Noxious Blades
description: {Wraiths}' have additional posion penetration and their melee attacks have a chance to poison enemies on hit.

sw42ih-24.name: Putrid Wraith
description: You have a chance to instead summon a {Putrid Wraith}, which Poisons enemies from a distance. Additionally all {Wraiths} deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

sw42ih-25.name: Delay the End
description: {Wraiths}' health decays more slowly.

sw42ih-26.name: Wraith Feast
description: Your critical strikes restore health to your {Wraiths}.

sw42ih-28.name: Serrated Scythes
description: {Wraiths} have a chance to cause enemies to bleed on hit.

sw42ih-29.name: Spectre of Death
description: {Wraiths} have a chance to apply {Damned} to nearby enemies on death.
reminderText: Damned is a stacking ailment that lasts for 3 seconds, deals 25 base Necrotic damage and reduces targets health regeneration by 20% per stack.

sw42ih-30.name: One Foot in the Grave
description: Gain ward for each {Wraith} summoned, but their health decays more quickly.

ts50pl-2.name: Bone Armor
description:
When you use Transplant you are granted {Bone Armor} for 4 seconds, which causes you to take less damage.

This effect has a 10 second cooldown.

ts50pl-4.name: Fleeting Form
description: Transplant has increased cast speed and cooldown recovery speed.

ts50pl-5.name: Apostasy
description: {Bone Armor} lasts longer.

ts50pl-6.name: Drink Deep
description: Transplant's health cost is regenerated over 4 seconds, but costs significantly more health (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ts50pl-7.name: Marrow Blades
description: Your minions deal additional melee damage for 4 seconds after you cast Transplant.

ts50pl-8.name: Simulacrum
description: You leave behind a {Bone Minion}, which is a temporary melee minion, when you use Transplant, but your previous body no longer detonates. Other detonations still behave normally.
reminderText: {Bone Minions} last for 20 seconds.

ts50pl-9.name: Transfusion
description: You may Transplant to minions, which sacrifices the minion. Sacrifice cast this way uses your Sacrifice Tree and deals more damage than usual (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ts50pl-10.name: Purgatory
description: {Bone Minions} last until killed, but you may have only 1 active at a time.
reminderText: {Bone Minions} are additional Melee Skeletal Minions that are spawned when you Transplant.

ts50pl-11.name: Ivory Court
description: You can summon more {Bone Minions}.
reminderText: {Bone Minions} are additional Melee Skeletal Minions that are spawned when you Transplant.

ts50pl-12.name: Scarlet Rain
description: Transplantâ€™s detonations deal damage in a larger area.

ts50pl-13.name: Cursed Exile
description: Transplant deals more hit damage to cursed enemies. Transplant hits against enemies afflicted with Bone Curse restore health. Transplant hits against enemies afflicted with Spirit Plague grant ward.

ts50pl-14.name: Ethereal Body
description: Transplant's base physical damage is converted to necrotic damage. Consequently this damage scales with increases to necrotic damage, but not increases to physical damage.

ts50pl-15.name: Squeamish
description: Transplant inflicts surrounding enemies with {Fear} on departure.

ts50pl-16.name: Thanatophobia
description: Transplant inflicts surrounding enemies with {Fear} on arrival.

ts50pl-17.name: Reign of Blood
description: Transplant creates an additional body that detonates on arrival.

ts50pl-18.name: Acolyte's Fervor
description: Casting Transplant grants you {Haste} and {Frenzy} for a short duration.

ts50pl-19.name: Doom Bringer
description: You cast Bone Curse around the target location after you arrive.

ts50pl-20.name: Hemophilia
description: Explosions cause enemies to bleed, but using Transplant also causes you to bleed.

ts50pl-21.name: Sticky Blood
description: Transplant detonations leave a {Pool of Blood} for 3 seconds that slows enemies.
reminderText: {Pools of Blood} are patches of blood left behind by certain skills which slow enemy movement.

ts50pl-22.name: Anemia
description: Transplant costs less health (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ts50pl-23.name: Siphon
stats: +3% Pool of Blood Maximum Health Heal
description: {Pools of Blood} heal you for a percentage of your total health when you walk on them.
reminderText: {Pools of Blood} are patches of blood left behind by certain skills which slow enemy movement.

ts50pl-24.name: Dance of Blood
description: You automatically cast {Rip Blood} at enemies nearby where you depart, but Transplant costs more health (multiplicative with other modifiers). An enemy cannot be hit by multiple instances of Rip Blood created this way.
reminderText: Your Rip Blood tree does affect Rip Blood cast by your Transplant skill.

ts50pl-25.name: Azure Veins
description: When you hit an enemy with Transplant you regain mana, but lose a portion of your current health and ward.

ts50pl-26.name: Pale Blood
description: Transplant restores mana, but has a longer cooldown.

ts50pl-27.name: Flesh Marquis
description: Transplant detonation hits deal more damage, especially to bleeding enemies.
reminderText: These effects are multiplicative with each other and with other modifiers.

ts50pl-28.name: Forced Fruition
description: When you are out of mana, Transplant detonations deal more damage.

ts50pl-30.name: Violent Emergence
description:
Transplant explosions instantly kill enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health). 

If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node, then the highest threshold is used.

ws54hm-2.name: Thin Veil
description: Wandering Spirits reveals Spirits more frequently.

ws54hm-3.name: Tethered Existence
description: Spirits deal more damage when they pass through enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers), but move slower.

ws54hm-4.name: Drifting Spirits
description: Spirits are revealed in a larger radius around you.

ws54hm-5.name: Infectious Dead
description: The base necrotic damage dealt by Wandering Spirits is converted to poison damage. Consequently this damage scales with increases to poison damage, but not increases to necrotic damage.

ws54hm-6.name: Familiar Souls
description: Spirits are revealed in a smaller radius around the player and deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ws54hm-7.name: Lingering Souls
description: Spirits last longer when they are revealed.

ws54hm-8.name: Drained Will
stats: 30% Necrotic Resistance Shred Chance Per Second
description: Wandering Spirits shred the necrotic resistance of enemies near them.

ws54hm-9.name: Terrifying Presence
description: Enemies near Spirits are {Feared} for 0.5 to 0.9 seconds, causing them to flee from the spirit that feared them.
reminderText: Enemies can only be affected by Fear once.

ws54hm-10.name: Harrowing Aura
description: Spirits can Fear enemies in a larger radius. If spirits inflict {Necrotic Resistance Shred} or {Damned} those ailments are also inflicted in a larger radius.

ws54hm-11.name: False Courage
description: Spirits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but the fear they apply to enemies via the {Terrifying Presence} node has a shorter duration.

ws54hm-12.name: Haunting
description: Fear applied to enemies via the {Terrifying Presence} node lasts longer, but affects a smaller area.

ws54hm-13.name: Prey On Fear
description: Spirits deal more damage to feared enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ws54hm-14.name: Medium
description: Wandering Spirits has increased cast speed and costs less mana.
reminderText: Does not affect how frequently spirits are created once Wandering Spirits has been cast.

ws54hm-15.name: Eternal Haunt
description: Wandering Spirits continues to reveal Spirits for a longer duration, but has a longer cooldown.

ws54hm-16.name: Daunting Presence
description:
Each Spirit is larger and deals damage in a larger area.

If you have {Terrifying Presence}, the area for inflicting fear is also increased.

ws54hm-17.name: Sheltering Spirits
description: You gain Ward whenever a Spirit expires.

ws54hm-18.name: Infusing Souls
description: You have a chance to gain mana whenever a Spirit expires.

ws54hm-19.name: Souls of Rage
description: Spirits move faster and deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ws54hm-20.name: Poisoned Minds
description: Spirits deal more damage to poisoned enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ws54hm-21.name: Spectral Putrescence
description: Spirits have a chance to cast {Spectral Putrescence} at nearby enemies each second. Spectral Putrescence is a projectile with 100% chance to poison on hit.

ws54hm-22.name: Spectral Scorn
description: Spirits cast {Spectral Putrescence} at enemies from further away.
reminderText: {Spectral Putrescence} is a ranged attack which inflicts poison on enemies hit.

ws54hm-23.name: Soul Of Filth
description: Spirits can cast {Spectral Putrescence} more frequently.
reminderText: {Spectral Putrescence} is a ranged attack which inflicts poison on enemies hit.

ws54hm-24.name: Locus Mortis
description: Spirits are now revealed around a target location, rather than around you. Spirits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: Does not affect the total number of wandering spirits revealed

ws54hm-26.name: Reap the Damned
description: Spirits deal more damage to cursed enemies and damned enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ws54hm-28.name: Song of the Lost Chantry
description: Wandering Spirits is now a channelled skill, has a much shorter cooldown, and creates Spirits much more frequently. You can regenerate mana while channelling this skill.
reminderText: Does not affect the total number of wandering spirits revealed.

ws54hm-30.name: Spirit Swarm
description: Wandering Spirits has a shorter cooldown

ws54hm-31.name: Sins of the Forgotten
description: Wandering Spirits inflict enemies around them with {Damned}.
reminderText: Damned is a stacking ailment that lasts for 3 seconds, deals 25 base Necrotic damage and reduces targets health regeneration by 20% per stack.
